item.content:encoded:
Good morning! I‚Äôm not having a great mental health day, but I‚Äôm here at the park with Dawa, he‚Äôs just chillen, not really though because it‚Äôs hot with 100% humidity. I‚Äôve got to get a little work done or I‚Äôm going to go absolutely nus, though. So, let‚Äôs write some CSS!

///

Whoops, didn‚Äôt write for a while! I was pretty low yesterday and earlier today, I‚Äôm looking forward to the future again though!

item.title: New Challenger!
item.description: Good morning! Up early and got Dawa on a bike ride, didn‚Äôt make it for the full run when we got to Stenger, though. I have to give him an‚Ä¶
item.content:encoded:
Good morning! Up early and got Dawa on a bike ride, didn‚Äôt make it for the full run when we got to Stenger, though. I have to give him an anti-anxiety pill today and get his grooming in, that‚Äôs on the docket. Also, it‚Äôs time to clean the apartment again, somehow. That, and it‚Äôs virtual garage sale time! Mmm, also have a phone call or two, but here‚Äôs the real news story:

I‚Äôve got a coding challenge as part of an interview process!

So stoked, about to set myself down to give this a shot! Two questions, JavaScript, no frameworks, just logic, half an hour!

// Okay, sweet! I was able to do it with 8 minutes left, which probably means I should‚Äôve taken 8 minutes to refactor, lol. Whew! Definitely had that moment, when the tests failed on the second question, of ‚Äúoh no, oh no nothing works, oh jeez‚Äù but pushed through! Cool site, too, Hacker Rank, I‚Äôll have to go back when I‚Äôm in application mode again. I wonder how legit it is. Huh, legit.

Alright, then, I‚Äôm going to go on a mad cleaning/handling-physical-stuff dash here to deal with the stress and get the rest of the day going! ///

Whew! Laundry folded, vacuuming done, sofa de-dusted, bike cleaned up, dishes done, dog bathed, brushed, nails done, and I‚Äôve got rice and beans on the stove right now. Mmm. Also, yay, responded to someone on LinkedIn who reached out, updated my resume there ‚Ä¶

The layout is just about ready to be filled out. Siesta time, though! I don‚Äôt know how a workout is going to fit in, though, my ankle is really feelin‚Äô it today.

item.title: Mr. Sandman?
item.description: Good morning! It‚Äôs super hot out! Also, still not a whole lot of that sleep thing going on! I‚Äôm sure I hit REM at one point, because I was‚Ä¶
item.content:encoded:
Good morning! It‚Äôs super hot out! Also, still not a whole lot of that sleep thing going on! I‚Äôm sure I hit REM at one point, because I was dreaming, I think that‚Äôs how it works, right? Anyway, my brain knows it‚Äôs on this side of a night‚Äôs ‚Ä¶ rest, at least. I‚Äôve got a plan, though, the plan involves me getting some work done here, though, so let‚Äôs hop to it. Dawa is taken care of, though he thinks he wants another walk right now. We went out on the patio for a little bit, we definitely don‚Äôt want a walk right now. Got to Harkness today, since I ‚Ä¶ I don‚Äôt want to call it ‚Äúsleeping‚Äù in, but I didn‚Äôt get up until six thirty today, which, accounting for a first walkies, means that twenty minutes from when we start biking is eight o‚Äôclock, when Harkness opens. I really prefer it if I‚Äôm not really up for technical single-track trail, which today I‚Äôm really not, still recovering from running around with my niece after a pretty decent trail run with Dawa on Saturday, plus the like, not so much with a rest or a break, and the plan for moving forward is to add another run/workout in in the evening ‚Ä¶ wish me luck, lol!

Alright, website time. It rendered, which is nice feedback to get when you spend, you know, whatever it was, eight to ten hours between design and authoring, that you aren‚Äôt totally off your rocker as far as markup and rendering logic go. I wonder if I should approach the CSS from an inside-out or outside-in perspective? Like, I could start with the small components and then when it‚Äôs time for the whole thing‚Äôs layout, it‚Äôll have that wow factor, or I could start with the outer layout and drill in, promising speed but the temptation to not get to the polish ‚Ä¶

Oh man, falling asleep standing up, that‚Äôs no good, lol. I just drank coffee. Great coffee, actually, thanks to my wonderful sister! I just remembered, from earlier actually, I was pushing Dawa up the first hill out of here this morning and I almost fell asleep walking. ‚Ä¶ Okay, fixed the Gatsby Link components, they just needed ‚Äò/about‚Äô or whatever, not the whole url.// Got myself together, I‚Äôm falling asleep standing here. I think I‚Äôm going to bust a quick mission, try to get a nap in, and then give it another shot here. Just going to add a few things to AppWrap that I thought of in the shower though ‚Ä¶ oh, the custom paddings and everything for that funky look the old layout had, that can go now, yay, lol! I‚Äôm glad that‚Äôs in the git history.

/// Next day, post-mortem:

Ooohkay, so that ‚Ä¶ kind of worked. I did get a nap in, got up, made herbal tea, took Dawa to the park for a bit, and I did go for a run, but I was not able to get any work done afterwards, just too tired still.

Well, to the future, best wishes, ~g

item.title: Lemonade
item.description: GOOD MORNING! I got like an hour and a half of sleep last night, and the coffee definitely has not hit yet, but my day light was set for‚Ä¶
item.content:encoded:
GOOD MORNING! I got like an hour and a half of sleep last night, and the coffee definitely has not hit yet, but my day light was set for earlier than yesterday, I‚Äôm up, let‚Äôs do this!

Huh, I thought I fixed photos ‚Ä¶ oh, wow, my Gatsby config file is all messed up, there‚Äôs nested plugins declarations. I don‚Äôt know how it builds at all, lol. Good job, Gatsby, and Gareth, what the hey? Okay, I need to prioritize, though, omg and Dawa just stretched lying on his side he‚Äôs the cutest ‚Ä¶ ahem! Prioritize! Gatsby config file gets turned into an issue, let‚Äôs get this React written. Go!

Oh, no, Dawa is awake and needs attention for the next two hours, lol. Effff.

/// Okay, yea, handled. Woof. I don‚Äôt know what I did, but images are back up. Posts with images, so far, if you want to catch up ‚Ä¶ not sure how long images hasn‚Äôt worked, lol:

  • Proudfoots - August 8th
  • Index and Layout and Blog-Post Oh My - August 6th
  • Rock, Roll, Repeat - August 5th
  • Oh, Hey Past-Me, Thanks For The Note - August 2nd
  • Floor Space - July 22nd
  • Overcaffeinated - May 29th
  • Sweet Word Cloud Bro! - May 24th
  • Sunshine - April 28th
  • Super Cereal - April 26th
  • Yet Another Day - April 3rd
  • Z-Day - April 1st
  • Everything Black - March 30th
  • Dahmbeyhrgeyhr!! - March 26th
  • The Space Between - March 20th
  • Back Up! - March 18th

Ayy, applied for a job! I hope they get back to me! Ooo, and the person I emailed said they would pass my name along to someone they know, very exciting! Yay for not appearing outwardly crazy to the other people at the dog park, lol!

Two jobs! Ha! What‚Äôs the next thing to work on, I need to get the laundry in, myself together, and Dawa outside for a bit. Might work from the dog park. Headers logic. This may be overkill for a button, it‚Äôs going to be awesome though, if it works out, I‚Äôm so stoked if I can pull this effect off.

// Okay, Dawa walked, albeit briefly due to the heat, laundry should be done soon, and let‚Äôs see how close we are to this thing rendering ‚Ä¶ query in blog-post template ‚Ä¶ uh-oh, I fixed a few things and it built. I wonder how awful it looks right now, lol. Oh, sweet, now the errors are just showing up at run time. socials.map isn‚Äôt a function, cool, can handle, forgot that‚Äôs an object, not an array, wrong data type

Oooh, that was confusing, it was telling me data was undefined for the default export of index.js, but the actual problem was that I was importing { Image } from gatsby rather than Image from gatsby-image. I saw a flash of bi pride before it collapsed this time! How exciting!

OH WOW! Guys! Guys come quick! It rendered! It‚Äôs so awful lollll!!!!

It‚Äôs rendering though!

Unfortunately, lack of sleep has caught up to me. I‚Äôm going to do everything I can to stay up another few hours here and make sure Dawa has enough outside time ‚Ä¶ except for drink more coffee. I had two cups today, and I think going off my caffeine schedule yesterday may have contributed. Also I got just way too excited to see my sister and her fam, and then had an emotional breakdown at like midnight, lol. I was going to say maybe I‚Äôll get more work done today, but I know when not to push myself, at least sometimes.

Best wishes y‚Äôall, ~g

item.title: Proudfoots
item.description: Lol and good morning! Got Dawa out on a trail run again this morning, just having my second cup of coffee before putting myself together‚Ä¶
item.content:encoded:
Lol and good morning! Got Dawa out on a trail run again this morning, just having my second cup of coffee before putting myself together, and I really want to solve the header problem really quick because I was thinking about it trying to fall asleep last night, but really quick, I just saw this commit message, Add a footer so that content does not abruptly end and that makes so much sense!

Okay, so MoreLessButton is going to be floating between the headers, meaning it‚Äôs going to be absolutely positioned and needs to know how many headers are open at the time, and then if the user closes any headers, start saving state to localStorage so they don‚Äôt have the headers open next time. Forgot to mention check if there‚Äôs ‚Ä¶ what are we calling this ‚Ä¶ headersCount? headerCount? Names are hard! Okay well it‚Äôs counting headers, but you count pages, too, but you don‚Äôt say pagesCount, you say pageCount, it‚Äôs implied by count that page may be plural.

headerCount.

// Alrighty, coding from Fort Trumbull! I‚Äôve got half an hour or so before Elsbeth and co. are supposed to be here, so I can ‚Ä¶ oh back, please cooperate. Th kinda works if I don‚Äôt really look at the screen, or use just my eyes, but it‚Äôs so tempting to lean forward ‚Ä¶ which I can do if I‚Äôm writing in English, I don‚Äôt know about JSX though.

Got the header situation handled, I‚Äôve got some coffee here and just wrote an email ‚Ä¶ phew, sent, nice, I think I used words good ;) How ‚Äòbout some JavaScript baby, yea! Made some coffee, it‚Äôs kicking in here, lol.

Oh, lordie, just went down the FP rabbithole for a while. Currying and Function Composition by Eric Elliot Then my back said no more sitting. I took Dawa to the park for a bit, I‚Äôm trying lying prone and seeing if I can do that. I just read a compelling argument for not just combining state and using the functional version of setState with a spread operator, recommended in the docs and all that. I think that refactor is going to have to be for tomorrow, though, I‚Äôm zonked. The alarm is set for earlier, let‚Äôs see if I can get Dawa ran and coding before 8! If there are dogs at the park when we get out from the trail-run, though, it‚Äôs going to be 8:30.

Tifme to wind down, though, peace and <3, best wishes, ~g

Footer .. heh ..

The title and description are references to Lord of the Rings, the movie, first in the trilogy, not sure exactly why that bit came to mind, but I don‚Äôt have these sorted by date, and having a memorable name is the only way I can find it quickly. Eyes are weird.

item.title: El Perro
item.description: Good morning! I‚Äôve been up since 5:30 and moving pretty optimally, Dawa and I got out for a first walk, then for a bike ride and trail run‚Ä¶
item.content:encoded:
Good morning! I‚Äôve been up since 5:30 and moving pretty optimally, Dawa and I got out for a first walk, then for a bike ride and trail run, and now we‚Äôre at the dog park and I‚Äôm about to finally be able to get some work in, I hope, lol. It‚Äôs just such an effort to be back to the house at 8 having biked miles across town towing him, and then dragging him on a trail run, which to be fair really is only until we get into the groove, then he does great, and his little paws are showing good texture, so the plan is working, but then I have to tow him back, get put together, and then he‚Äôs like in my face for more attention, and about at the end of my rope here, but there‚Äôs coffee at least, and hopefully I can escape into some headphones soon here.

Okay, morning meeting with myself time, what‚Äôs on the docket ‚Ä¶ okay, got my files here, bio is partly deconstructed, layout is set up once I‚Äôm ready for CSS, working on index, up to Sidebar on mobile.

Okay, here‚Äôs the last commit before main got rewritten 9bf4ca9b9470934b5063c70893bed3968d4fd0bb ‚Ä¶

Oh, lord, that‚Äôs what‚Äôs going on with the tabs. I forgot how crazy that was to set up. Okay, umm ‚Ä¶ DepNav, right, I renamed it. This thing needs wiring up a certain way, though. Back inside we get, working out here is too difficult ü§£

Tabs has to encapsulate Tabs and Panels, and is where the state for the index of the panel lives. Tabs are buttons that get useTabState() for an onClick, and need to be wrapped with React.forwardRef. Something funky is going on with useRef there, too, I‚Äôm not really sure what. Oh, nevermind, I do, that focuses on the coding tab, I thought codingRef was related to something I was testing at some point.

// Alrighty, had a snack I was getting hangry. I need to do some cooking here, there‚Äôs nothing really prepared and quick, so I made just the crudest cheese sandwich and got it down my gullet, lol. Closer to calorie-even today though. There‚Äôs some soup for later, and rice and beans to make, and I need to figure something to do with red lentils ‚Ä¶ anyway, back to React-land ‚Ä¶

I really don‚Äôt like how the tabs are right now, component-wise, but I want to get the rest of this design more filled out here first.

Hooof, mobile done, at least Index. I guess now would be the right time to wire up Layout ‚Ä¶ pheeew, done with the markup, for the moment. Doesn‚Äôt exactly build yet, though, definitely made up some variables and functions there. Wonder how many errors in the build tool ‚Ä¶ 13, NICE! 11! 10! Good enough for now, time to take Dawa out again!

// I just had to explain to someone that it was not Black people‚Äôs fault that they were enslaved. What. The. Fuck.

‚Ä¶ MOVING ON. 8 errors. 6 errors.

Hooof. It‚Äôs definitely coming along, pretty stoked, then my resume and personal website are both going to be pretty dope. I‚Äôm losing it a little here, though ‚Ä¶ maybe because I took a day off with Dawa yesterday, that‚Äôs why he‚Äôs so needy today? Okay, next steps here ‚Ä¶ branch from the old site so I can post these, and then the next time I‚Äôm in the code, I was just figuring out how to handle socials and filling all that info in, and the quote of the day, and then the header state management and invoking localStorage, and then the build should at least succeed, and we can be working with feedback in the browser! üèéÔ∏è

Until tomorrow, be well and best wishes! ~g

item.title: Index And Layout And Blog-Post Oh My
item.description: Good morning! Somehow it‚Äôs still morning! I was up early today, got Dawa out, and then instead of taking him for a bike ride I went for a‚Ä¶
item.content:encoded:
Good morning! Somehow it‚Äôs still morning! I was up early today, got Dawa out, and then instead of taking him for a bike ride I went for a long run, which my legs were kinda not ready for, but I started back up after a walking break and made it home, then worked in the park a little with Dawa hanging out with his buds, he was pretty chill, I took him for an afternoon run yesterday on top of his usual morning run, which included socialization and sprints yesterday. I thought about what I needed to do with the code on the run today, now I just need to bust this out. Pen and paper time, though, I was looking at it at the park and I think I know the todo list I need to make, but concentrating there was less than ideal, due to nearby construction and being right on the, albeit relatively quiet, road, so now I‚Äôm back inside and Past-Me left Future-Me (and Dawa) air conditioning, thanks Past-Me!

Now on with the show!

Here‚Äôs how it looks at the moment:

Oh, sweet, dude, I didn‚Äôt even notice that I broke the whole little tabs thing I had going on there. Yyyea, site overhaul long overdue. Mobile was never really even accounted for except for what came with gatsby-starter-blog ‚Ä¶ let‚Äôs wrangle this spaghetti monster in.

Bio takes in location, then if it‚Äôs root it returns a fragment with either a wrapper with an Image and a p tag with a links saying follow me on Twitter or hire me, lol, or a ‚Ä¶ slightly differently styled wrapper with an Image and a p tag with a link saying follow me on Twitter. Info about the author and the Twitter account, as well as the source of the Image, come from a useStaticQuery call. Bio is rendered as the first non- react-helmet component inside Layout from index.js, and inside a footer in blog-post.js, right above the navigation. Inside Layout. ü§Æ

Index takes in location and data from a page query, then it ‚Ä¶ oh, how sad is that greyed-out import statement up there, I meant to do something better for mobile, lol. Okay, well, it returns Layout with location and a title that comes from data, then the whole home page, passing the whole data object through to BlogList, in the coding panel. It used to handle state regarding tabs, I don‚Äôt know what happened.

Moving on to blog-post, which takes in location, data, and pageContext, and returns a Layout with location and title (from data,) Seo with stuff from data, which I realize I hadn‚Äôt mentioned in the previous paragraphs, but they were there, and an article and nav, populated with data and pageContext, also including Bio in the article, with location.

Now Layout, which imports Global, and takes in location, title, and children, then checks if location is root before defining Header as either a LandingHeadingWrapper with an h1 with the title, and the hamburger, or an h3 with the title, then it returns a fragment with Global, then checks if location is root and either LandingMainDiv or OtherMainDiv with the same contents, a header tag with Header, a main tag with children, and a footer.

‚Ä¶ so what we need is ‚Ä¶

Okay Bio dismantled, for starters, just need to not lose the ‚Ä¶ the location part only gets used one, but the graphql query needs to be in index and blog-post, the Twitter thing will be handled elsewhere, and soak up the looking for work part in a GitHub issue.

Index then needs to take that graphql query in, and then make a media query, and then, to layout, pass either one set or another of things already spelled out in ./index.html. Also, all of the markup that makes up the homepage should live here, not in Layout.

Blog-post should have Bio taken out, and the graphql will have to be added to the useStaticQuery, and also should make a media query. I think? It looks like the Typography module is making it‚Äôs own media query, though it isn‚Äôt doing much with it. Should either review its scale and rhythm functions or switch to something else.

The last Syntax FM with lobotomized owl CSS, that one might be good to listen to for the next revamp.

Okay so then Layout needs to make it‚Äôs location check if it‚Äôs root or not and then we need to add a media query, because at least with the homepage, we‚Äôre going to be rendering different content that needs to be wrapped accordingly. Layout can contain the wrapper components, as well as global, but the homepage‚Äôs components should be moved to index.js.

// Ooohh, I just typed so much! And there‚Äôs more to do! I‚Äôm glad I got organized first! I‚Äôm going to keep going here for a little bit, a few nights of bad sleep have caught up with me, though, and I can feel the end of my daily productivity approach. My eyes droop, etc. Just back from a walk with Dawa and the juices are flowing, for the moment, so let‚Äôs go!

My dog is being so distracting. Everything is being so distracting, though. I don‚Äôt appear to have the energy to filter things out very well and not get emotional about noises. Really tried to continue my productivity, if I don‚Äôt turn the A/C on and try and reset my brain, here, I‚Äôm going to have a conniption, lol.

I‚Äôm working on main like an absolute fool, so today‚Äôs post will probably be up tomorrow? Anyway, best wishes! ~g

item.title: Rock, Roll, Repeat
item.description: Gooood morning! Dawa and I got out on a bike ride to Stenger Park after our first walk again today, and he got to run around with some‚Ä¶
item.content:encoded:
Gooood morning! Dawa and I got out on a bike ride to Stenger Park after our first walk again today, and he got to run around with some huskies after running the trail with me, and we‚Äôre ready to work at 9:15 here, and he‚Äôll be good for a long while today, so not bad. I‚Äôm drinking some cold brew made with a blend specifically made for it, it‚Äôs crazy good. I haven‚Äôt had black iced coffee that tasted sweet like that, I don‚Äôt think ever, this is really some good stuff.

Next up is Reactifying this layout, and since my build broke and I suspect just like, everything needs updating, I‚Äôm going to start from a new templete and build the site up from that again. Just like with React Native, it‚Äôs often better just to blow the project away and start again, with all the dependencies that go into these projects. One of the nice thing about Python, that a lot was built in, but I was doing different stuff with it, and it‚Äôs great that web technologies can evolve so quickly.

// Eugh, okay, third walk, now we‚Äôre good.

Gosh, yea, I checked the build files, it seems to just be a versions thing. Images working just fine when I copy my blog content over to the starter, for some reason it just isn‚Äôt pointing to the file in /static ‚Ä¶ oh, /static isn‚Äôt being populated with any of the remark-images stuff at all. Ooohkay moving on.

Right, so most of the base stuff is copied over, now we‚Äôre at the part that makes my head explode every time. There‚Äôs index, which is obviously special, and then there‚Äôs blog-post, the template, and both take in the Layout component, and then so the Layout component needs to be aware of it‚Äôs location and split into different parts, so yes, start here, and also remember that if you need any more templates or pages ‚Ä¶ oh, and 404 has it‚Äôs own thing, too. And credits. ‚Ä¶ and also, Layout takes in children, as well as location and title, and creates the markup for the header based on location. üçù

Oh sweeeet, just needed to check gatsby config and make sure everything was valid and -gatsby-plugin-sharp was loaded first!

// Phew, got Dawa on another run around the block, champion of a little guy he is, then I got some groceries, got a chicken in the oven, back at it!

Yaaay thanks Shelly for the re-Tweet! Shelly‚Äôs the best. Looking forward to showcasing some of her art in a side project!

Okay, let‚Äôs get this thing done. The hard part really is that the degree of how convoluted the setup is, it‚Äôs like a black hole sucking my attention in. I need some sort of diagram. Pen and paper time. Now I know at least the build isn‚Äôt totally pooched.

Werd, so now I‚Äôve looked through it and taken paper notes, and now I‚Äôm pooched, and this whole operation is going to have to start tomorrow morning. Hopefully here‚Äôs a picture of a dog!

Best wishes! ~g

item.title: Supa Smooth
item.description: Good morning! Dawa got a bike ride, some socializing with other dogs, a short run in, and I‚Äôm good to go at 9am, yay! Yesterday we needed‚Ä¶
item.content:encoded:
Good morning! Dawa got a bike ride, some socializing with other dogs, a short run in, and I‚Äôm good to go at 9am, yay! Yesterday we needed another walk afterwards, and I had things to do around the place, not today though! Onward!

First project is the resume, which will be a snap because I spent the time breaking up what needs to change into issues, so let‚Äôs see ‚Ä¶ I bet I can be done before 9:30. Let me go ahead and double that, though, unless I‚Äôve learned nothing about how good I am at estimating how long a task will take. 10:00, and if I‚Äôm not done by then, I‚Äôve got to clean the bathroom. It needs doing at some point here, it‚Äôs not like horrific or anything, but I‚Äôd rather not, so how about that‚Äôll be the consequence if I don‚Äôt. Except I‚Äôm going to do one or two things here and then clock in for an hour from whenever that is, because it‚Äôs been a couple of minutes already and a part of my brain is saying no fair, lol.

Okay, so the strategy is going to be to set the timer for 15 minutes and switch to standing ‚Ä¶ 9:15, go!

Oh, shoot, I need to speed up, it‚Äôs been 15 minutes already? Go go go!

// Well, I got a lot done, having the right amount of pressure is a wonderful thing, guess who‚Äôs cleaning the bathroom though. ü§£

Dawa and I are at the park now, it‚Äôs really nice having a backup machine dedicated to working outside and moving either around the apartment or wherever else I might be.

// Alrighty! V4 of the resume! It‚Äôs got a repo now, too! And I have a PNG of it, and that‚Äôs definitely going up on the website, I‚Äôm sure it‚Äôs accessible somehow, but now it‚Äôs like ‚Ä¶ ohhh, man, if I loaded it in from GitHub, I could always have the most up-to-date version ‚Ä¶ do like, one more change then ‚Ä¶ sweet!

Next up is the layout, let‚Äôs see ‚Ä¶ I think I had gotten through the markup for mobile, but wasn‚Äôt done with the markup for desktop ‚Ä¶

Sweet, got that figured out, time to switch to CSS mode! Ehh ‚Ä¶ actually, I mean I went to spin up a stylesheet.css, but that‚Äôs one of the nice things about styled-components, I can do the Reactifying first, and then write scoped CSS. The next thing to work on is whether I‚Äôm going to nuke this thing or not, so seeing what the latest scaffolding for gatsby-starter-blog is ‚Ä¶ hmm, okay so just looks like updating to the v2 versions of gatsby-remark-images and anything else in the build step will probably do it, though I wonder what the scaffolding looks like now anyway ‚Ä¶

Also, thanks Elsbeth! My sister caught that I hadn‚Äôt paid any attention to the months field in the resume. She suggested deleting it, I‚Äôm on the fence about it based on how nicely it ties the sections together when the consistency issues with caps, and slashes and dashes was fixed. Okay, markup for desktop complete, Reactify, then style.

Until tomorrow, best wishes! ~g

item.title: Oh, Hey Past-Me, Thanks For The Note
item.description: Good morning! I didn‚Äôt sleep all that well last night, but through the power of routines am somehow ready to rock and roll here, put‚Ä¶
item.content:encoded:
Good morning! I didn‚Äôt sleep all that well last night, but through the power of routines am somehow ready to rock and roll here, put together, the dog is wiped out from a run and is happy to have gotten a bike ride in, and I found a nice place to position one of my corkboards so I can have the notes from two and three days ago up, which was when I discovered that Past-Me had left me a note to ‚ÄúPlz gfcom-p-h thx.‚Äù

‚Ä¶ Well, then. Obviously meant something there ‚Ä¶ and then it dawns on me that it‚Äôs gfcom-public-html which I‚Äôve been meaning to do a diff of the commits between builds for like ever.

Whoa.

So I‚Äôve got this ‚ÄúQuiet Hours‚Äù playlist going, and there‚Äôs this kinda hypnotic track playing, and git diff HEAD^ HEAD was scrolling by in the terminal, and something must have been minified, because a lot of comma-seperated seemingly random five- or six-character strings were going by, for like a while, and I was thinking the scene where he‚Äôs looking at the code and seeing the Matrix, and I kind of zone out for a second waiting for it to finish catching up on the scrolling so I could exit and refine the diff to just give me files, and it switches to words and phrases, and for just a moment there I was like, oh, my God, it‚Äôs happening.

It was not, that was plain English in markdown files, the diff was just scrolling through another file. Maybe someday Neo, lol.

Oh, git diff --name-only SHA1 SHA2, thanks ‚Ä¶ ‚ÄòPeter‚Äô on StackOverflow. In there with that name, nice. Wonder who that is.

Oh my God ‚Ä¶ this is his bio, I kid you not, ‚ÄúI am not actually called Peter. Sorry about that.‚Äù Hundred and six thousand reputation though, focus on git and then Ruby and Python.

Alrighty, sweet though, it‚Äôs index.html, the folder with the blog post name, index.html in that folder, the folder in page-data/ of the blog post name, page-data.json in that folder, and rss.xml. I‚Äôll script that when I‚Äôve got it in me to deal with string functions. I need a break from string functions. Let‚Äôs see if this works, though ‚Ä¶

TESTING ‚Ä¶ Hooray! Much better than selecting all files and folders in and ftp GUI and then unselecting the ones you don‚Äôt want deleted. Honestly I think I lost a folder at some point along the road here, lol. cgi-bin/, did I need that? I hardly ever look at the Apache stuff on the server.

I‚Äôm going through a bag of light roast at the moment, which is not the freshest, it‚Äôs pre-ground, but at least it‚Äôs a light(ish) roast, and was on sale. I‚Äôm not sure whether I want another hot cup of that or a cold cup of a coffee marketed as good for cold brew that my sister gave me, (thanks Elsbeth, we‚Äôll talk soon!) but I think I‚Äôll keep letting the A/C do it‚Äôs thing and go for the hot coffee, in the hopes that Dawa will really not need atention for a while if at least it‚Äôs cool in here. AWW he just went and found a blanket to snuggle up in, bless his little heart.

Okay, coffee made, back to it, I need to do other things right now, but TODO on scripting that last thing up, and ready set go.

Huh, well known dev tool Anaconda‚Äôs website is broken from 768px width to 991px. I‚Äôm throwing no stones here, to be clear, my website is broken at any device width, just funny to see the web being broken sometimes. Oh, no, it‚Äôs their enterprise page too, not just their individual page. Oh well, I get the feeling anyone who‚Äôs maybe an Anaconda customer would understand about browsers if they were using a tablet in that range. Time to eat the frog, though.

Yay, frog eaten! There was an email I was hesitating tackling, but I made myself an outline and handled it. Phew! Weight of ye olde shoulders, ya know. And uhh, link to ‚ÄúEat The Frog‚Äù, an approach to getting things done. (Apparently named for a Twain quote, who knows.)

As Mark Twain once said ‚ÄúIf it‚Äôs your job to eat a frog, it‚Äôs best to do it first thing in the morning. And if it‚Äôs your job to eat two frogs, it‚Äôs best to eat the biggest one first.‚Äù

Okay, moving on, this one job wanted Pandas, so maybe I‚Äôll just learn that real quick. That‚Äôs the attitude you‚Äôve got to have, the title of the posting looks perfect, but the first line they need Pandas, I mean, how hard could it be? We‚Äôre coding, right? Let‚Äôs do this!

WHOA Anaconda is cool! Oh, sick, also the icon overlays the Android Studio logo to give you this:

Oh, but I forgot images aren‚Äôt working right now, lol. Wah-wah. Soon. First Pandas, lol. Oof, actually though, first moving my body, I was just sat down for a while and my back said nope :\ / :)

/// Oof, that turned into a whole adventure. I‚Äôm exhausted. To pick up from before, first resum√©, then Pandas, oh and also, how many animal names can I stuff into my resum√©? Python, Pandas, Anaconda ‚Ä¶ oh, there are less than I was thinking, at least among the easily googleable ones. Total aside though, there‚Äôs a pythonforbiologists.com! Interesting! I miss mathy stuff like this! Okay, exhaustion is setting in, bon soir and best wishes! ~g

// Yaaas, I now have a spreadsheet with the subject and location of all of my official papers. item.content:encoded:
Good morning! Oh jeez, what a day so far! So I definitely messed the whole master-blaster program up, again, then I fixed it I think, but there‚Äôs still a little bit to iron out. Fortunately, Dawa is cool just chillen for a while, since we got a nice trail run in, and I‚Äôve had a second coffee, so let‚Äôs do this!

Eugh, okay, the clone command is throwing a warning that needs to be handled, what else ‚Ä¶

Oh, lol, so what I broke, mainly, was if localDirectories was turned on, it would check the repo if it had a local directory, or if localDirectories was off, then it would check all repos, but I didn‚Äôt have the else statement set up for if localDirectories was turned on and there was no local directory. Whooopsie.

Also, why is the rm temp dir command not running properly? And why is it running push ‚Äîdelete origin master? And why is locallyBlastIt being cloned?! Ahh!

Ohhkay, so if the remote is set with, say, ‚Äòtwitchkidd‚Äô rather than ‚ÄòTwitchkidd‚Äô with the capital T, the string check to see if there‚Äôs a local copy of a repo fails!

Omg I think I did it! Yes! It all works!

// And I wrote out a contributing doc at the dog park!

And we‚Äôre settling for having to pip install questionary and requests in order to run it for now, at least it‚Äôs pip and not pipenv.

And it‚Äôs on PyPi! Please nobody have gotten anything lower than v1.0.6, lol! Probably not.

And so that was task 8 from yesterday, and then there‚Äôs just the last one, to get the word out about it! 9: Tweet!

Lol, I‚Äôm reaching for the command line because I‚Äôm still in the mode of working on master-blaster, but a) going to twitter.com is much easier, and b) done with working on master-blaster for a while! Almost a little bit of shock, like, wow, really, done for now, there‚Äôs the version upgrade on pypi.org. Crazy.

Yea, wow, okay, Tweeting, it‚Äôs happening, I sent out like seven messages in bottles ‚Ä¶ ooh, TerminusDB said it ‚ÄúLooks great!‚Äù Wow!

Okay, other than being glued to Twitter, I‚Äôm done with this type of thing for the day, I‚Äôm wiped! It‚Äôs cooking time, about to make some soup, rice, beans, and figure something out with red lentils!

Best wishes! ~g

item.content:encoded:
Good morning! I just got all the todos to get this thing to like an acceptable state on paper, here, and Dawa‚Äôs been run, he‚Äôs chillen, let‚Äôs do this! I‚Äôm going to title the sections what I wrote on the sketch pad:

1: Tell if it‚Äôs local

Did this one, check. I wasn‚Äôt sure I was running the script from the project or from pip, print("hey") did it though. :)

2: [List of changes to the text]

2.01: Warrantee/Specify GNU 3+ at least

Lol first of all, GNU General Public License v3 or later (GPLv3+), good try, then currently, we see:

master-blaster Copyright (C) 2020 Gareth Field This program comes with ABSOLUTELY NO WARRANTY; This is free software, and you are welcome to redistribute it under certain conditions;

and now:

master-blaster Copyright (C) 2020 Gareth Field This program comes with ABSOLUTELY NO WARRANTY; This is free software, and you are welcome to redistribute it under certain conditions; GNU General Public License v3 or later (GPLv3+);

So that‚Äôs an improvement at least. The license calls for implementing show w and show c for displaying the warranty ‚Ä¶ and ‚Ä¶ copying ‚Ä¶ and oh my goodness, I spelled warranty way off when I wrote it down just now, ‚Äúwarrantee‚Äù? Lol, we‚Äôll just leave that in, but so I decided to go all the way in this direction for the warranty and intro text:

master-blaster: Rename primary branches of code repositories. Copyright (C) 2020 Gareth Field field.gareth@gmail.com

This program is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by the Free Software Foundation, either version 3 of the License, or (at your option) any later version.

This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU General Public License for more details.

You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License along with this program. If not, see https://www.gnu.org/licenses/.

Whew.

2.02: master-blaster version in logfile.

Just in case anyone happens to still be using pre-1.0.5, so then their logfiles won‚Äôt have it, and may be why they‚Äôre having problems, apologies. Shouldn‚Äôt have been anything too major, I hope.

Beuno. The intro also looks beautiful now.

2.03: Switch log/Gihub notice, First:

Yeap, first part I did, changed the username prompt to have First at the front of it to be like ‚Äúreally, this is the starting point of the application.‚Äù

2.04: Confirm GitHub username

Starting with the primary verb good. More question marks bad. questionary is already adding question marks to every line after a prompt.

? First, please enter your GitHub username!
Twitchkidd
? Confirm GitHub username: Twitchkidd (Y/n)

Better! Ooo!

? First, please enter your GitHub username!
Twitchkidd
? Confirm username: Twitchkidd (Y/n)

Beuno.

2.05: rm parens from repotypes

Oh, yea, I‚Äôm logging the option chosen, and right now the whole string includes an explanation that collaborator/organization updates are still in development. Okay, fixed.

2.06: too many lines for local ask

It‚Äôs true. Too long. But all of that was critical info, so it‚Äôs two three line groupings now rather than one five line block.

2.07: rm middle sentence projects q

Hmmm, what did I mean ‚Ä¶ Oh, that‚Äôs probably okay to stay, actually. Moving on.

2.08: rm first part of token q, whitespace

Yea, the token question really needs tidying up. // Phew, that took a little doing. Got a link to the docs in there, looks more balanced ‚Ä¶ oh yea!

? ‚Äî Get a token! ‚Äî

Since password-based token generation is being deprecated, please get a personal access token with the correct scope(s) to run this program!

To get this token, go to https://github.com, sign in, then go to ‚ÄòSettings‚Äô, then ‚ÄòDeveloper Settings‚Äô, then ‚ÄòPersonal access tokens‚Äô, then ‚ÄòGenerate new token‚Äô, confirm your password, name the token in the ‚ÄòNote‚Äô input field, select the public repo scope, then ‚ÄòGenerate Token‚Äô, and then copy it to your clipboard.

Please save it somewhere first in case there‚Äôs an error!

For more thorough (and visual) instructions in the GitHub docs, see the personal access token part here: https://bit.ly/2X0cr3j

Paste it back here into the prompt and hit enter to continue:

2.09: git branch is being printed

Okay, processLogger updated ‚Ä¶

2.10: git alias printing

Yeap, processLogger updated.

2.11: switch thank you and log

Nice. All the copy is tidied up, I think.

3: Local master delete logic

Okay, switch languages, this is a problem with my Python, not my English.

Ohh, that was a hack, lol, I really should have taken the time to refact it to an array, but instead I just made another parameter secondIgnoreStr="" lolll. Hopefully won‚Äôt need to go too much further there! ü§£

Ooh, git alias is still printing, actually, my hubris bites me on the butt for not testing 2.10!

Fixed fixed fixed.

4: rm dir logic

Yea, running rm -dfR on anything unecessarily is no beuno.

Dope, needed to be handling error states with that process anyway. One more global variable, but no biggie.

Wow, and then that‚Äôs it then:

5: Directories test

So this is where I need a repo to be in each of the following states:

Already has main, has master - External main conflict. (Seems the case could be made based on defaults as to whether to delete remote master.) Already has main, doesn‚Äôt have master - Already blasted. Already has main, doesn‚Äôt have master, and there‚Äôs a local with main and master - Local master delete. Doesn‚Äôt have main, has master, default is master - Blast it. Doesn‚Äôt have main, has master, default is master, and there‚Äôs a local - Locally blast it. Doesn‚Äôt have main, has master, default isn‚Äôt master - Default not master conflict. Doesn‚Äôt have main, doesn‚Äôt have master - Who.

Aside ‚Ä¶ why is it still checking collaborator and organization repos? Oh, I‚Äôve messed it all up, lol.

Best wishes, ~g

item.description: Good afternoon! What a few days! I can‚Äôt recall at the moment whether I finished up two days ago‚Äôs post, or if I even made one. Pretty sure‚Ä¶
item.content:encoded:
Good afternoon! What a few days! I can‚Äôt recall at the moment whether I finished up two days ago‚Äôs post, or if I even made one. Pretty sure I didn‚Äôt finish up yesterday‚Äôs post. Sometimes an official sign off isn‚Äôt possible. C‚Äôest la vie. (‚Ä¶ la vie!) :)

So, today my morning‚Äôs moment of creative genius went to the processLogger function, then I fleshed that out a little and am ready to test the processes, also I have the Python extension for VS Code open on the other machine, and there‚Äôs this wild thing called Jupyter that they suggest, so I‚Äôm checking that out, it‚Äôs like if you could just slap some Python into your Google Doc, but with extra crazy sprinkles on top for visualization, and the whole application is both super nice for features and easy to share stuff with, and also not just Python but like a whole bunch-ton of languages.

Ooo! Also, I used an access token for the Strava API from Python and it worked! V. excite! I‚Äôve been naming my runs specifically with this moment in mind for the past several years! Literally!

If the run is named like ‚Äú4mm Merrells‚Äù, so just a specification of shoes/barefoot, I was alone, and 4mm Merrells vs 2mm Merrells just means Trail Gloves vs Vapor Gloves, and barefoot is always ‚ÄúBarefoot‚Äù and then so if Dawa is with me, it‚Äôll always be named like ‚Äú2mm Merrells with Dawa‚Äù or ‚Äú4mm Merrells pushing Dawa‚Äù if I‚Äôm running with or pushing Dawa in the stroller, respectively. This could be good for my own training, sure, but if I can also include data for whether Dawa is running on trails or pavement and score how his little paws are doing over time ‚Ä¶ just like, being able to make a plan for him would be great, rather than guessing and playing it by ear, there‚Äôs got to be a way to visualize this and make things easier ‚Ä¶ also I get to pick a charting/visualization library to try! And learn the Strava API!

Okay, I need to switch to sitting on the sofa so I can keep doing this, I‚Äôm at like two hours of sit and focus time today, the next task is fortunately just a lot of work rather than needing a whole lot of creative energy. I‚Äôm going to make this code so much more readable, with way less lines of code. Okay, so it‚Äôs 1161 lines right now, let‚Äôs see what we can bring it down to.

Oh, before I go, so I can wrap up quickly later, the title/description thing, I went through every paper I have, which is many papers, though now fewer, and sorted them into five categories and then garbagio. Personal and work still need sorting through, they‚Äôre shuffled a bit, but official, archival, and questionable content, stuff flagged as ‚Äòdo I need to keep this?‚Äô, all in seperate physical spaces. Having at least some notion of control over my life beyond the confines of these walls, and knowing that if I need to look for something important that I could either find it or not find it and know within a reasonable amount of time with a reasonable amount of certainty is no small comfort.

Okay, sofa! I revamped the sofa area so there weren‚Äôt boxes and now there‚Äôs a servicable and charming nook and hopefully Dawa is okay with just chilling there for a bit until I cook his dinner, because there‚Äôs ‚Ä¶ like two dozen cases of subprocess.Popen that need processLogger applied ‚Ä¶ which is really on me to have been dense enough to repeat that many times, but I was so close to being able to say, ‚ÄúHere! This works! More or less! For the brave, go for it!‚Äù ‚Ä¶ sooo, now I need a post-it note with DRY taped to the monitor, but also to fix this mess. With the function‚Äôs definition and applying it once we‚Äôre at 1179 lines, from 1161, but it could maybe go down to 1080 lines?

Hmm, well I implemented it again, and fixed the function, but I had to comment about a bug and what to do about it after a few more implementations, so we‚Äôre at 1188 lines. I hope this doesn‚Äôt turn into spaghetti. Pressing on ‚Ä¶

Oh, indexing to get the nth item of a tuple is awesome. I love Python. 1178 lines. 1159.

// Okay, so I know how to use it now, that took a bit, but that‚Äôs going to be easy-peasey in the morning. Dawa got steak tonight, some socialization with a very cute black puppy down at the park, I‚Äôve eaten as well and am winding down! Good day! Tomorrow‚Äôs going to be great!

1 bike 1 day 1 bike 1 run 2 day 2 bike 1 run 3 day 3 bike 1 run 4 day 4 bike 1 run 5 day 5 bike 1 run 6 day 5 bike 2 run 7 day 6 bike 2 run 8 day 7 bike 2 run 9 day

Yay 9 day streak of running with Dawa, and only twice did I run him around the block instead of biking him to a trail for his little peets. Ahhh. My dog is happy though.

Best wishes, ~g

P.S. Huh. Apparently images aren‚Äôt working in blog posts, so the above will read as ‚ÄúDawa dozes soundly‚Äù instead of being an image, at time of posting. Curious.

item.description: It‚Äôs about right for mid-July, holy moley though, let‚Äôs not with the ninety degrees. I got like two thirds of all the papers sorted today. I‚Ä¶
item.content:encoded:
It‚Äôs about right for mid-July, holy moley though, let‚Äôs not with the ninety degrees.

I got like two thirds of all the papers sorted today. I decided what the categories were going to be and which went where, then took all the papers out and lined them up in piles, and decided to work from left to right. I‚Äôve got an extra table in from the patio and had the long table cleared, and had both filing cabinets the the desk emptied and the top of the desk cleared, and ‚Äòwork‚Äô was going to go on the desktop, ‚Äòofficial‚Äô in the desk on the left hand side, ‚Äòpersonal‚Äô in the desk on the right hand side, ‚Äòarchive‚Äô in the white filing cabinet, ‚Äòquestionable content‚Äô in the brown filing cabinet, as in, ‚Äúdo I need to keep this or document its existence?‚Äù, and the green filing bin for anything I‚Äôd want to bring out in case of a fire. Plenty got thrown in the trash, and I‚Äôm just about there with seperating it into categories, but a lot of it was about Mom, too, so I was like barely able to get through the day with just one breakdown, lol. Actually, it was about Dawa, too, though just the whole ‚Äòdeath‚Äô in general theme. We only did a mile this morning because my knee was hurting and I wanted to cut it short, so like all the attention he got today was, well there was the last walk, which was pretty short because it‚Äôs so hot out and nobody is outside, not too interesting, then a short one earlier in the afternoon, that mile before, and we got some grooming in before we left, and our first walkies. item.title: Master Blaster V1!
item.description: Good morning! Hope you‚Äôre well today, I‚Äôve just gotten to my desk, dog is walked, got a cup of cawfee heea, missin New Yawk just a little‚Ä¶
item.content:encoded:
Good morning! Hope you‚Äôre well today, I‚Äôve just gotten to my desk, dog is walked, got a cup of cawfee heea, missin New Yawk just a little ;)

Okay, so, it‚Äôs Monday, and Saturday I said, ‚ÄúHere, world!‚Äù with the program I‚Äôve been working on for three weeks, which felt like tossing it into the abyss a little, which was to be expected, but now starts phase two! Very exciting! I‚Äôm going to split my time between making improvements, other coding projects, and coding-adjacent stuff like making moves on getting a job, rather than being totally obsessed with one thing to the detriment of everything else in my life, lol!

Good times, though, learned a lot. Let‚Äôs talk about it!

Python!

What a pleasure to work with! I wasn‚Äôt sure I was ever going to branch off into different languages, I‚Äôd just spent so much time in JavaScript land, and other languages just felt like scary distant shores, what a joy though!

Not like I‚Äôm leaving JavaScript, I think. I‚Äôd been thinking of picking up a project to bring this flight/drive data filetype importing/exporting library to the latest version of Blender, and that‚Äôs definitely still on the table now, especially now I have a better grasp of the language it‚Äôs written in, but I really miss the web, and apps, and, go ahead, shoot me, semi-colons. I miss semi-colons. Especially with syntax highlighting, I think they make code more sparkly, and I like putting punctuation in my sentences, and in my code. Oh, and brackets, holy-moly, this indentation thing I cannot do. I know it‚Äôs annoying when you get the number of brackets off, doubly so because it‚Äôll still run sometimes and do unexpected things, but trying to just look at it and try and count the blocks of whitespace to no no no, nope, do not want. Though, thinking back on it, I only really had trouble with massively indented code because of how I structured it.

Let‚Äôs browse the code and see what jumps out ‚Ä¶

Imports

The actual syntax is nice, which can be said for most of the small words used in Python, import questionary or from subprocess import Popen, PIPE is great, the dependencies thing I still don‚Äôt have my head around, because in JS it‚Äôs either from node*modules, which, fair, is magic from the build tool, or it‚Äôs import AppTextInput from "../components"; if you‚Äôre doing like export * from "./AppTextInput.js"; from components/index.js, the ambiguity of where imports came from was just a little weird to me, but actually one of the reasons this project was well-suited for Python was that there _weren‚Äôt* too many dependencies. The code that edits your repos is right there, not super-abstracted with possible security vulnerabilities, other than me writing bugs into the code, lol.

Iterable Slicing, Working With Iterables

I miss JavaScript, here. Maybe my thinking is backwards on this, and am just experiencing Stockholm Syndrome, but having like slice, splice, the spread operator, and using forEach or map/filter/reduce explicity rather than ‚Ä¶ well, it‚Äôs definitely a little different than the Python way of doing things. I totally appreciate that it sort of encourages you towards abstraction, where in JavaScript after a map call you‚Äôll have like the place before the arrow or after ‚Äòfunction‚Äô for assigning whatever the arguments are going to be named, but in Python it‚Äôs for noun in nouns: and you‚Äôre off to the races. Possibly easier to grasp, I‚Äôm not sure. I learned in the context of React, from the beggining to today with hooks and stuff ‚Ä¶ definitely helped having learned it the hard way like that, I think, or the Python syntax where the keywords are doing a lot of heavy lifting, character for character, would maybe have gone over my head.

That being said, I‚Äôm excited to go further down the Python way, pretty wild, man, pretty wild.

I‚Äôm also excited to refactor this beast ‚Ä¶ let‚Äôs just say it could be much better looking, lol. Let‚Äôs talk about what I learned from a general project standpoint!

Project!

First of all, yay, I made something! I‚Äôm pretty sure it does what it says on the tin, too!

Natural Language Hard

Okay, then though, writing text is hard! Like the text the user reads. Copy? Anyway, that took a ton of energy to context switch from coding to writing, I need to do a better job of batching that stuff and when I need to do some on the spot, just not spending too much time on it. That and naming things ‚Ä¶ like localBranchInfoGitBranchStdout or confirmRemoveLocalDirectoriesAfterPrompt ‚Ä¶ very descriptive, but jeez ‚Ä¶ but then I went to acronyms later on, so GitPushUpstreamOrigin just became Gpuo, but that wasn‚Äôt much of an improvement, at least not when it was repeated over several lines ‚Ä¶ refactoring the logging code into a function is one of the next things on the list, it‚Äôs going to help make it more readable, hopefully.

Commenting!

As I started the project meaning for it to be open source, I paid way more attention to commenting my code than I ever have before, which I‚Äôm definitely going to keep doing! This probably falls under natural language being hard, too, but yea, having to describe what the code does with words is a nice little check that you‚Äôre doing what you think you‚Äôre doing. Tests is probably the next step on this road, lol.

Testing!

Yea, I kinda just tested that each piece of code worked as I went. I can see how this might not scale. (Lol.) To the future.

For what it‚Äôs worth, though, Python seems to do what you think it‚Äôll do. Really nice.

Projects!

GitHub Projects has been awesome to use! I hadn‚Äôt really used issue tracking before, it was a great way to organize what needed to be done and stay on task, though! I still used a fair amount of paper, maybe like 20-25 sketch sheets, it‚Äôs just a lot easier to get my brain working when I‚Äôm holding a pen sometimes, but having a kanban board right on the same page as all the code really helped keep me productive.

I ended up not using the Software Requirements Specification that I made in a Notion doc as much as I thought I was going to. That might change in the future, I can see how a little extra time with the requirements might have helped.

The Future!

What next? Well, the program isn‚Äôt done, really, though it‚Äôs gotten to a point of completeness, from a certain perspective. It does work. It could do more, it could be better tested, like on Windows machines, or it could be made to handle interruptions in the connection, which I think just knocks it over at the moment. It also needs to get used, and I need to get the word out, which is like a whole other thing.

I‚Äôd also like to split my work between that and some other projects I‚Äôve got going on, like I got the artwork back from Shelly for the Polar Pairs game I was working on, and RunClub should be ready when the world is ready to socialize again, lol ‚Ä¶ and my personal website still looks like the mess of hot garbage that took me like a couple days to throw together, definitely could be a better portfolio, lol.

Then there‚Äôs updating my resume, writing cover letters, filling out applications, definitely crunch time there.

It‚Äôs also a better time than ever for teaching more people how to code! I mean, sort of, there‚Äôs a pandemic on ‚Ä¶ Crazy world we‚Äôre living in right now, keeping my spirits up though!

Next steps are to update the project for V1, since I kinda just put it out there without strictly sticking to it, and what‚Äôs done is done, but it‚Äôs time to set up the scaffolding V2, and also it wouldn‚Äôt be super-nice for anyone else to walk in on expecting to pick up and issue or something at the moment.

Then I‚Äôm going to clean my apartment. Needs it. I‚Äôve been totally obsessed for three weeks, and I do my best to keep things clean, and I think I vacuumed once, but there are dishes, very little food in the fridge, it‚Äôs dusty, the vacuuming needs doing again, the bathroom needs cleaning, the patio needs cleaning, stains need obliteration, a colony of shrews has set up shop in the outdoor storage, you get the picture. (Jk on the shrews. Good luck with the gophers, Els!)

Ooof, then some business needs handling that I‚Äôve definitely let slide, and yes, job, I know.

Exercise is handled, however, for the moment, lol. Yesterday I didn‚Äôt type at all and just took excellent care of my dog, since I‚Äôm afraid he‚Äôs ‚Ä¶ well, I mean, definitely not neglected, he‚Äôs been getting regular runs that you can see on my Strava profile, but I‚Äôve been getting in every bit of coding that I could, taking my laptop to the dog park, only taking him on short runs sometimes, and I‚Äôve been brushing him, but he needs more, especially with this heat, he can‚Äôt be having any matting. Oh, but so yesterday I biked us over the bridge to Bluff Point in Groton and ran the trail with him there, which is eight miles total pulling him in the wagon behind the bike, plus the running, and I am worked today! I was going to get up super-early, to be in the swing of things, but turned the alarm off at 4 and didn‚Äôt get up until 7.

Time to make up for it! To the future! Best wishes! ~g

item.content:encoded:
Good morning! I‚Äôm going to be able to see today! Very exciting! And Dawa is rolled over on the floor still panting after a bike ride to Harkness and back with a 2 mile run in there (hot, even at 8am, have to shoot for earlier!) and I‚Äôve got another coffee and the package with my glasses!

For like two weeks, I haven‚Äôt been able to see, and no blue light protection, so I‚Äôm waking up with my eyes red like I‚Äôm stoned or something, also, ouch, and I really don‚Äôt need more pain right now. Managing back pain has like, partially taken over my life right now, lol. But new glasses! Not going to trust the outside pocket for anything that could potentially bounce out again, lol, went downtown and they were gone, even went back over the route twice ‚Ä¶ eff! They were such nice glasses, too. The first pair I had, and that was a great story, good times, anyway, they made me feel like ‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm having a hard time describing it ‚Ä¶ like I‚Äôd embraced my feminine side, to a degree, but these made me feel like I could be who I was and feel not just appropriately androgenous or whatever, but really good looking ‚Ä¶ I know it‚Äôs crazyily vain, but with that little modification to my face I was able to bring waaay closer to one hundred percent at work and in public. That was right when people at work not only had been appreciating how hard I worked to make things nice and to look out for them and everyone in that place on both sides of the line, but they heard my story and told me that I was accepted, that I belonged there. That brought a lot of closure on the previous ‚Ä¶ when was that? Obama was president. I don‚Äôt ‚Ä¶ know ‚Ä¶ oh, so Google Photos says in late 2015 I was at Merrell, so this must have been like October 2016. So, eleven years.

Big shoes, new glasses, big shoes. I got them online too ‚Ä¶ so much cheaper! Let‚Äôs see, let‚Äôs see!

Haha, well, let me try again with the look thing when I‚Äôve cut my hair and lost a few pounds, but I can see! Nice!

Can‚Äôt code though, Dawa wants to go out again. Had a feeling we might need one more walk here, he hadn‚Äôt pooped on our first walk. C‚Äôest la vie avec chien.

import { css } from "styled-components";

const size = {
  small: 400,
  med: 960,
  large: 1140,
};

export const above = Object.keys(size).reduce((acc, label) => {
  acc[label] = (...args) => css`
    @media (min-width: ${size[label] / 16}em) {
      ${css(...args)}
    }
  `;
  return acc;
}, {});

export const below = Object.keys(size).reduce((acc, label) => {

}, {});

item.title: Re-Cover
item.description: Good morning! So first off, I want to get some of the styling changed so that this thing kinda feels like mine, and then I‚Äôll want to work‚Ä¶
item.content:encoded:
Good morning! So first off, I want to get some of the styling changed so that this thing kinda feels like mine, and then I‚Äôll want to work on it more. Not that I don‚Äôt want to work on it, but when someone else wrote all the styles, you know, it‚Äôs just like ‚Ä¶ what is this? Next is colors, then icons, but first, the serif font looks terrible next ot the sans-serif font! I love the sans-serif font, Hattori Hanzo, but Artifika next to it looks totally whack ‚Ä¶ okay Museo is dope, I‚Äôm going to try it out, and if I have to buy the license later, so be it, I‚Äôve got up to 500,000 page views per month for a website for now, with the 500 weight Museo Slab.

Yea! So good!

Okay, I replaced the sass variables I blew away yesterday, I‚Äôm not going to worry about swapping all of that over right now though. Icons ‚Ä¶ Oh so good! SVG is still a mystery to me, but I can dig into them at least a little bit nowadays!

// AHHH Dawa got me out for a walk but wouldn‚Äôt walk, and one of his pads is kinda raw! I think I need to give him a chill pill at some point, he‚Äôs used to being so active, but both a) the load on him is just different since we started training, and b) I have to do this thing! Just quit my other job, definitely go-time, lol!

So the plan for the moment though is to get to parity, then plow through the course to get to users, and that‚Äôs where the game changes. There‚Äôs a dozen-plus videos after that, definitely email, definitely setting up the api, deployment, conquering user-land is a biggie though. Go go go!

Oh, thank goodness, I did it. All store stuff is now run stuff, no bugs, beautiful, leh-go!

Moving on with the course, learning about file uploads and chaining middleware ‚Ä¶ and I finally used this blog as a reference, yay! I was getting an error that photo.resize wasn‚Äôt a function, so I copied in the stepped solution and it worked, but I couldn‚Äôt spot what had changed, so I went back and looked up how to diff between the current and previous commits, made a temp folder, and I‚Äôd forgotten to await jump.read(req.file.buffer) ‚Ä¶ silly me!

// Alrighty, got through aggregation! That was a doozy! Think I more-or-less got it though, good thing I‚Äôve already done some work with chaining map-reduce-filter, so that‚Äôs not really that foreign to me! It‚Äôs been a few hours though and I‚Äôm starting to lose concentration, so it‚Äôs cleaning party time! Woo! // And back to it :)

Multiple queries in a controller, dope, cool to see Promise.all in the wild. And on to user accounts! And soup!

Aaand we‚Äôve got registering a user! More or less! Still getting some jankiness in error states, like the request body doesn‚Äôt seem to repopulate the fields, and different errors are handled either by the form or by flashes, but the happy path works, failures are handled one way or another, beautiful!

Saw that one job made up and disappeared, applied for another, walked Dawa, cooked for Dawa, finished the dishes, broke one of the glass chambers for my French presses, started a list of things I‚Äôm going to buy when I have a job in tech, and gooood night!

Best wishes! ~g

Oh, P.S., Dawa had an awesome little play-sesh with Pepper and Lola, and I think it‚Äôs probably just his pad worn down than any real damage, crossing my fingers and thank God! I saw him limp a little today and my heart dropped, and I‚Äôd thought I‚Äôd really hurt him, but I think he‚Äôs good! Eep.

P.P.S. Two applications, yay, g.

item.title: Easter Eggs
item.description: Good morning! It‚Äôs beautiful out, Dawa and I got a run in, and I‚Äôm going to work on Run Club for the web for a bit, because I want to. So‚Ä¶
item.content:encoded:
Good morning! It‚Äôs beautiful out, Dawa and I got a run in, and I‚Äôm going to work on Run Club for the web for a bit, because I want to. So there! :)

Just learned that React Router and Reach Router are going to be combined, and that React Router is going to be the surviving product, but it‚Äôs going to have a new hooks-based API brought out in a minor release ‚Ä¶ //

Ohhhkay, so, it‚Äôs somewhat later, and I‚Äôve ‚Ä¶ what did I do? I‚Äôve gone through the Auth0 single-page-app and API setup, which was new again since hooks and context became big, the code is so much cleaner, but I‚Äôm glad I‚Äôve been using hooks and context for a little bit, or I‚Äôd have no idea what the heck was going on. Yay for the Node code being easier to read, too!

The plan now is that I‚Äôm going to go with Mongo, so I can say I know the MERN stack, and people know what that means, and I can find plenty of content to learn it, and if I want to go back to Hapi and RethinkDB at some point, it can be to test perf, and that looks good, too. Uhh, anyway, the slightly larger picture is that I‚Äôm going to set up some UI prepping for a set of CRUD operations, then get the database going and test everything locally, then I‚Äôm going to learn how to use environment variables and nuke my git history so I can make the repositories (and that I‚Äôm working on them) public without giving out keys and privite IP addresses, all that good stuff, then I‚Äôm going to get the SPA up on Linode, get the A record and C-Name and nginx and node and all that jazz set up for trailcity.net, then I‚Äôm going to get the express server up, then the DB, test it all in prod, as it were, and then we‚Äôre off to the races. Set up a continuous integration flow, set a sprint up, and get to the continuously integrating!

I‚Äôve also got to sort through the job listings, and cook and do dishes and take care of the dog, and I‚Äôm going to set myself the reward of taking Dawa to the trail when I‚Äôve applied to some jobs. Got down to the bridge on route to requisitioning supplies today, and took note of how wide the narrow parts of the pedestrian/bike path are, and I‚Äôm pretty sure I can get the trailer through, though I wouldn‚Äôt want to try it at speed, lol.

Anyway! Next step, some UI! I should have a route for new runs (new adventures? I feel like it would be a missed opportunity not to abstract ‚Ä¶ T minus thirty to adventure time! üòÜ) and a route for runs where you could update and delete (and read.) I think Bumble‚Äôs got it down with the three tab thing right now. Aaanyway ‚Ä¶

Oh, wow, still not-so-much support for datetime-local in Firefox, Safari, or IE, I mean, IE no surprise, but it not being in Firefox or Safari ‚Ä¶ oh well, date and time work in Firefox and Safari, we‚Äôre going with that. And Formik, hooray!

// I‚Äôm taking such small steps here, but steps they are! Oh boy ‚Ä¶ how do we use fetch? What sort of request am I making? How do I send a payload? What do I include in the fetch request to say what type the body is, and what do I include so that the server can parse it? We‚Äôre getting there, lol.

Ohhh, I hate the new MongoDB stuff! I‚Äôm going to keep going for the reasons stated above, but wow, sold right out! I get it, there‚Äôs money to be made, they could have made the experience better though, like, I have to want to give you money, I don‚Äôt want you to try and trick me into it. Big oof.

// About to help out a new developer in Los Angeles with some React stuff. Pretty stoked to be doing anything other than what I‚Äôm doing right now because I really don‚Äôt want to look at Mongo stuff any more right now. I go to the point where my Node app is listening for the client and talking to the Mongo instance and I‚Äôm about to try inserting some documents unless Patrick can please send me the video call link any faster, lol.

// OOOOHHHHKAAAAY I JUST SPENT FOUR AND A HALF HOURS TUTORING SOMEONE, WHOA. GOODNIGHT.

And best wishes! ~g

item.title: C'Est La Vie En Gare!
item.description: Alright, so, didn‚Äôt get the job ‚Ä¶ didn‚Äôt get this job! Didn‚Äôt get a job in tech yet! Made it through an interview and didn‚Äôt get laughed off‚Ä¶
item.content:encoded:
Alright, so, didn‚Äôt get the job ‚Ä¶ didn‚Äôt get this job! Didn‚Äôt get a job in tech yet! Made it through an interview and didn‚Äôt get laughed off, and now with that matter concluded, as well as the Logoed project, I have a tremendous amount of freedom in this moment! (Language is important! Can‚Äôt change the past, only ourselves in this moment! Allonz-y!)

To table something, the apartment people will need to be dealt with here, as they were not exactly either forthcoming or knowledgable about the emergency updates to the grace period as far as rent goes, but I need to act on the highest priority matters right now, and so I shall!

So there‚Äôs like three pieces here, what to work on, getting applications out there, and community involvement.

Back to front, community involvement. Just waded through the Reactiflux Discord, definitely worth being on there, the help sections are invaluable, it‚Äôs good for mental health to be able to chat with folk, and the jobs section is always active. Twitter, too, same, always seeing hot tips, hot takes, and hot jobs there. I‚Äôd love to start a New London JavaScript meetup when things get a little bit back to normal, so that‚Äôs something to plan for. Also, involvement in Open Source is a great way to learn and looks good on the resume.

Then job applications. I‚Äôve got a few lists/places to look, so I thought what I‚Äôd do would be to put together a list of jobs that I‚Äôd really like, places I‚Äôd really like to work at, all that jazz, and then make a list of jobs I could maybe fit at, places I‚Äôd maybe like to work at, all that jazz, and then make a list of jobs that were definite maybes, so to speak, and then start with the definite maybes, and then by the time I get to the jobs I‚Äôd really like, I‚Äôm a tech-application-filling-outer pro, and I‚Äôll be very likely to actually apply to the whole list that way. I remember when I was a kid and got sugary cereal with marshmellows, I‚Äôd eat all the non-marshmellow bits first so basically I‚Äôd end up with candy at the end. Nutritionally questionable, but a sign of good planning skills and self-motivation from an early age! üòÜ

Okay, what to work on is an interesting question. Totally valid to polish up the Logoed project, but it would be really nice to have a break from that. Then there‚Äôs my website, it‚Äôs definitely starting to be a little painful both updating it because I‚Äôm not sure exactly what‚Äôs changing between builds, and now I know how to use git diff! Also painful just looking at it, it‚Äôs pretty horrific, lol. There‚Äôs also a few small things I‚Äôd like to do with React Native, one is the splash screen issue in RN60+, and also getting down the flex: 1, vs display: flex; thing, might go through FlexBox Froggie and throw some penguins in there and build it in React and React Native. Speaking of penguins, there‚Äôs games to be built, that‚Äôs always fun! There‚Äôs also Run Club, kinda no better time to work on that, too! (And the other machine is upgrading to Catalina!)

As far as what I do today, I think I‚Äôll go back up that list, work on some code for a while, work on applications for a while, and keep thinking about community stuff throughout, staying on Reactiflux and looking out for any open source libraries that need help along the way. Okay go!

Splash60Plus, init! I was so annoyed that I (totally my fault) broke the whole app I was working on trying to get that one bit of polish, when like it‚Äôs the first impression, and surely other people are doing this too. To Google! Ooh, or to GitHub!

Okay, this repo is massive, wtf, and this wasn‚Äôt updated after 2018, but resource 1 is (Rohit Sharma‚Äôs epic Documentation Repo)[https://github.com/rohit120582sharma/Documentation/wiki/React-Native-~-Splash-Screen#create‚Äîadd-splash-screen-in-rnn] he says in (another part)[https://github.com/rohit120582sharma/Documentation/wiki/React-Native-~-Application-Architecture] that he‚Äôs using react-native-splash-screen ‚Ä¶ I don‚Äôt see that he goes into it any more than linking to the library though, and I don‚Äôt know what version of RN he‚Äôs on ‚Ä¶ What a wiki though! Holy moley!

Oh, okay, first hit in the code tab, I don‚Äôt know where in the tree this is, but it‚Äôs an Infinite Red starter (ACR Talk)[https://github.com/jamonholmgren/acr-talk/tree/c9ad09522caa27f8b89e820c8afad041f0eef5f2/AcrReactNative] ‚Ä¶ RN 0.60.5 and react-native-splash-screen 3.1.1 ‚Ä¶

Splash60Plus under source control, LOL. Oh, build failed off the bat, lol! Right, on-device testing needs provisioning ‚Ä¶ Signing and Capabilities > Team > TrailCity Inc. (heh ‚Ä¶ ehh ‚Ä¶) ‚Ä¶ Building ‚Ä¶ Building ‚Ä¶ Yay it runs. I need to put myself together and walk Dawa again now before trying Android, because it‚Äôs not showing up in adb devices and I don‚Äôt remember what I did to get this working. It‚Äôs not kill-server, it‚Äôs not turning debugging off and on again. USB driver? Anyway ‚Ä¶ lol, so before I go, I tried another cable, and that worked! ü§£ And I‚Äôm going to assemble job listings while walking Dawa rather than just listening to a podcast or music or whatever! To the future! //

OOOHHKAY SO: HELLO EXHAUSTION. It‚Äôs still pretty brisk out, and I just walked around the block for multiple hours going through job listings. (Candor.co)[candor.co] is great, but wow ‚Ä¶ so much ‚Ä¶ so cold ‚Ä¶ ow my back and shoulders from holding the phone. Let‚Äôs count ‚Ä¶ because I‚Äôm still in the ‚ÄòA‚Äôs ‚Ä¶

Actually, starting with the ShopTalk Show listings, actually, 21 listings, 4 were no longer hiring, 1 I couldn‚Äôt tell, two were for other specialties (backend, data vis,) 5 were for senior roles, 3 had specific requirements in terms of experience/portfolio, 2 were Tier One choices (yay!), 1 was Tier Two, there was a support role, and one started off with ‚ÄúWe have a passion for the Church ‚Ä¶‚Äù ‚Ä¶ yea.

Ahhh, there are dozens left still in the ‚ÄòA‚Äôs!!! So this site says either ‚ÄúHiring‚Äù, ‚ÄúNot Hiring‚Äù, ‚ÄúMixed Accounts‚Äù, or ‚ÄúLayoffs‚Äù and updates live, which is awesome, but most of the postings don‚Äôt have links, so Googling every company, trying to find their careers page, going through their job listings, and most of the time it not being a developer position or being for a senior role has been totally exhausting on mobile. Now I‚Äôm back to my computer, this might be a little faster ‚Ä¶ going to try to get through the ‚ÄòA‚Äôs ‚Ä¶ //

Oh my gosh, it‚Äôs 5:30, and I got through the ‚ÄòA‚Äôs on that last walk with Dawa. At least I stopped writing down every one where it wasn‚Äôt going to work. If I kept going at that same rate, it‚Äôd take me two weeks just to go through them, so obviously that‚Äôs not right. Also there are other sources, like AngelList, keeping up with Discord and the React subReddit, and there‚Äôs Hiring React Native ‚Ä¶ I think I need to focus on being a full-stack dev with React, React Native, and Node, and see if I can produce some work that‚Äôs a little more polished. Run Club was actually pretty far along before I stopped working on it ‚Ä¶ and I need some sort of process here of continuing with all of this, or I‚Äôm going to lose it. Like procedurally, because what I‚Äôm trying to do is complicated, and mentally, like ‚Ä¶ deep breaths, here. The dog and the cold and the financial stress and the pandemic compounding everything, I‚Äôm a little on edge here.

Done with job stuff for now though. Where was I with dev stuff? I should power through, tonight. Android build failed with either a gradle thing, a path thing, or a network thing. Try the build again, lol.

Oh you know what I just thought of? My sister said sometimes artists need help with websites, I should look for art that has art as the subject, and do some photoshopping, that would be funny.

‚Ä¶ My dog decided that dinner was acceptable with a little cheese sprinkled on top. Hooray. üêï

No, running droid again did not fix the problem. Probably rules out network. Let‚Äôs see if Android Studio can do any magic here. Checking path is next. // Wait ‚Ä¶ connect timed out? I‚Äôm two feet from the router, what‚Äôs happening? Okay, I just edited the global gradle properties and comment out the proxt lines as per (stack overflow)[https://stackoverflow.com/questions/42516117/android-studio-gradle-sync-failed-connection-timed-out-connect,] and my dog is whining at me. Yeap. Really glad the app built, on our way out, lol. // Aight, well, global WTF WAS THAT?!? ‚Ä¶ That was Camille, dropping Bella‚Äôs leash and freaking out, at the same time as whatever is happening upstairs was happening, so I thought Camille had fallen again or something.

Aight, well, global gradle.properties, comment out the proxy lines. Git commit. git checkout -b acr ‚Ä¶ yarn add react-native-splash-screen ‚Ä¶ todo myself on learning react-native-dotenv ‚Ä¶ oh boy, so I need to todo myself on learning how they do this whole thing. The gist is that they‚Äôre calling setUpRootStore in a useEffect(()=>{stuff},[]) in app.tsx, and stuff sets rootStore as state, and if !rootStore, return null, and they‚Äôre only calling hide on the splash screen in storybook mode. I wonder if it‚Äôs because there‚Äôs a rerender caused by the state changing that negates the need to do so explicitly? Let‚Äôs go with that, for now.

Oh, wait, it wasn‚Äôt just the react-native-splash-screen readme that got me there last time, it was (this article from Spencer Carli!)[https://medium.com/handlebar-labs/how-to-add-a-splash-screen-to-a-react-native-app-ios-and-android-30a3cec835ae] Okay, now I have two sources at least, one that I can trust that it works because it‚Äôs RN60+ and Infinite Red, and the other because Spencer Carli and I‚Äôd actually followed it before back in 2017 or 2018, but understanding what‚Äôs really going on here needs a clearer head than mine right now, except for food, hygeine, and other essentials, I haven‚Äôt stopped for more than twelve hours, and I‚Äôm like done-zowski here. I wish I could just go and go and go. Maybe when I‚Äôve got everything more dialed in, my ankle is better, Dawa and I can train up midday and the endorphins (todo link to that post) are flowing, I‚Äôll be able to crank out 14, 15, 16 hours of really good work in a day. I‚Äôm looking forward to it. For now, my back hurts, I‚Äôm exhausted, Dawa and I are going to get another run in tomorrow, probably another something close to 3 or 4 miles since he hasn‚Äôt been trained enough recently (entirely my fault,) and Lord have mercy.

Best wishes, ~g

P.S. Did I add react-native-splash-screen AFTER checkout -b? silly goose ‚Ä¶

item.title: What'd We Learn?
item.description: Today I‚Äôm going to go back through what I‚Äôve worked on for the past couple of weeks and pick out what I learned, what I can work on to‚Ä¶
item.content:encoded:
Today I‚Äôm going to go back through what I‚Äôve worked on for the past couple of weeks and pick out what I learned, what I can work on to improve, hopefully arrive at universal truth and beauty, all that. Or just not wanting that knowledge to immediately leak out through my ears. ü§£

But first! I couldn‚Äôt get the new disk drive cable to attach to the bracket, so I tried just plugging it in and leaving it outside of the machine, and it‚Äôs working! I think! It didn‚Äôt recognize the boot USB at first, but I reset the NVRAM and PRAM and it booted right up and started installing MacOS High Sierra! Holy cow! Ordered a new cable plus bracket, pretty cheap, considering I get a whole backup machine, just in case.

// Okay, so, an update on my day, I meant to get to work like way sooner, but I worked out, worked the dog out, cooked and did meal prep, got supplies, walked the dog again, and went through a video of stuff I have to deal with that my father sent me, and now it‚Äôs 4pm. Bit of an oof, but I took care of my body and at least some of what I had to do ‚Ä¶ still haven‚Äôt heard from the company I interviewed with and I‚Äôm kinda just wishing the hammer would drop, but moving on!

1: Working Yourself Super Hard and Sleeping Is Great

I seriously wish I could wake up with the answers to whatever it was I was working on the previous day spilling out of my head and jump up out of bed (ha) to write it down and be energized every single morning. Freaking amazing when it happens, doesn‚Äôt happen all the time. Moving forwards, first of all I know it can happen, so the next plan is going to include trying to get it to happen more consistently (by working myself super hard and trying to get good sleep sleep) while also recognizing that when it doesn‚Äôt happen, having routines, process, and discipline is what gets you through.
