Say what you will about making coffee first thing in the morning, I believe Michael Pollan wrote about the dangers of this in one of his latest books Caffeine: How coffee and tea created the modern world, but I get up and I know what my next steps are, generally.

Lol, on that first day when I woke up and started working on Logoed again, that night, ‚Äúthere are sounds coming from everywhere right now, and I can‚Äôt handle it ‚Ä¶‚Äù ‚Ä¶ Yeap. Like two nights ago, almost totally lost it. Please let this all work out so I can escape every night being movie night upstairs, yelling tweaker man, and Camille, bless her heart, with her somewhat endearing and ineffectual, yet loud, alarming and automatic admonition of her dog Bella.

2: Auth, Navigation, and useContext, Oh My!

Holy moley is the standard screen-to-screen navigation library for React Native (react-navigation) better as of v5, and I was able to get a decent user authentication system set up in like less than a day of work, or at least a user authentication system set up in less than a day, and worked out some bugs in my reasoning and understanding the next day. So nice! Everything is a component or a hook these days! I had no idea how to use the Context API when I was writing class components, too, coming off of Redux, and I‚Äôm still not sure I quite get it, but I know how to implement basic global state management, including user authentication, and wire it all up, and it‚Äôs a beautiful thing. It used to be that you‚Äôd start a React Native project and then wrestle with these things for weeks and hopefully you‚Äôd get there with it, and not touch it again until you really, really had to.

React Native 60+

Speaking of new hotness, I‚Äôve never added so many dependancies that required linking and had them just work before! Auto-linking is a beautiful thing, and developing with React Native has gotten so much better since it first came out! And yes I do feel like an old man because I was coding when ReactJS came out, and it‚Äôs been a longer time between now and then compared to that moment and when JQuery came out! ‚Ä¶ and yes I did pull in the entirety of JQuery for $.ajax at one point, lol. It‚Äôs been a long road.

The native side will still get you, though. I tried adding react-native-splash-screen to the project, which really requires some modification of the native code, and I know I‚Äôd done it before because the old RunClub project had it, and I even got rid of that flash of a white screen that annoyingly accompanied my beautiful splash screen for it, but the basic templates have changed since then, and I totally broke everything. This is when I learned a lesson about keeping my project under source control! Or hopefully I learned it! I certainly learned about git diff, and that I‚Äôve advanced enough that the manual pages for git commands aren‚Äôt totally scary anymore!

Setup

As of a couple weeks ago, I didn‚Äôt have Internet at my apartment, and the cable I was using to connect my phone was wonky, and things are better now,, but they sucked. Can‚Äôt forget that my dude in Lagos hasn‚Äôt even been in contact for a week, and who knows if his country has like, electricity on the regular at the moment.

Styled-Components, and Other Elegant Solutions

I didn‚Äôt actually end up using them, though I was about to run into having enough components reused to start. The one thing that‚Äôs a big TODO is to figure out exactly how the React Native flex attribute translates to, and can be translated back from, flexbox in CSS, because it‚Äôs a whole thing. Most examples of other people‚Äôs code is in the standard React Native style={{ attribute: 'value' }} format, but if your app gets big enough ‚Ä¶ I mean, you can keep doing that and use components, but I‚Äôm just so used to seeing CSS look like CSS, and being able to take in props in a styled component without having to remember to explicitly consume them ‚Ä¶ I dunno, the mental model just feels nicer to me.

For about two weeks though, I hardly used styled-components, and was just throwing inline styles at things and seeing if I could get them to look okay. Same with things like state management, where I really only used Context because I couldn‚Äôt figure out how to lift the state up properly, and prop-drilling ad nauseum. Oh and conditional rendering and abstraction, I just didn‚Äôt feel like doing it, if the lines of code I‚Äôd have to write weren‚Äôt going to save me time getting to my goal of sending a demo of the design concepts off to Dave. Maybe if I‚Äôd started earlier with it, the end result would have been more polished ‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm not sure. Just something I‚Äôm still learning to keep an eye on.

Ooo, right, like Formik! If I ever have to build a serious form in React again, totally reaching for it, but for little stuff, a controlled component is just so many less lines of code! Forgot about that one ‚Ä¶

Looking Back, The Gist

Wow, so the big themes are that each of the problems I faced were solved by taking a step back and being able to think clearly, that it‚Äôs a lot of work every day to be doing this thing, that it doesn‚Äôt need to feel like a lot of work if I‚Äôm taking care of myself and am being mindful of really experiencing the process, including all the tangential things like participating in the community, and that I really have come a long way here, and also have a long ways to go.

I‚Äôm so glad I started writing about this every day! I‚Äôm sorry if anyone is actually reading along, lol, especially two days ago where I realized the description in the frontmatter of the markdown document wasn‚Äôt necessarily displayed in the post, so the first sentence just went massively whoosh, but just for me, I‚Äôm going to wake up tomorrow and know that I can really do this thing, and it doesn‚Äôt matter in the long run whether that company gires me or not, I‚Äôve got a lot of value I can add to the world and I‚Äôm going to do it!

Allonz-y! ‚Ä¶ and best wishes, üòÑ ~g

P.S. Just helped someone out in the help-react-native channel on Reactiflux with some of the stuff I learned about screens and hooks in the last couple weeks! NICE!!

item.title: Just About There ...
item.description: Good morning! Got my second cup of coffee ready here ‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs going to be a big day! One way or another! Hoping to finish off this Logoed‚Ä¶
item.content:encoded:
Good morning! Got my second cup of coffee ready here ‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs going to be a big day! One way or another!

Hoping to finish off this Logoed project today, which I‚Äôve been saying for almost a week, lol, but fo‚Äô rizzle. Hoping to hear from the folks who might employ me today! Crazy! Either way, game time! Also, it‚Äôs time for another major clean of the apartment. I mean, it‚Äôs not really that bad, I did a major clean ‚Ä¶ what, a week and a half ago? I haven‚Äôt cleaned the bathroom after Dawa‚Äôs haircut though, so there‚Äôs dog hair everywhere, the dishes need doing, the laundry needs doing ‚Ä¶ For the moment, coding is going to happen!

The hard thing is going to be the x-y problem. The easy thing is going to be styling the pages afterwards ‚Ä¶ I hope, lol. I mean, I also hope the x-y problem is easy ‚Ä¶ ow, I hope my back doesn‚Äôt hurt like this all day, I‚Äôve only been sitting five minutes üòê Oh, and did the image disappear? Oh, no, that was because I switched top and left.

X and Y.

Okay, so we‚Äôre running setXY(e, gestureState) => { setX(x + gestureState.dx / pixelRatio); setY(y + gestureState.dy / pixelRatio); } and logging x and y with a useEffect hook, and the nice thing is that at least the logo is like, stopping when drag is released, because before what it would do would be to like, keep going for a bit after, like you‚Äôd let it go and it‚Äôd think, nah, I‚Äôd rather be another forty pixels or so in the direction you just moved me in, and jump there. So there‚Äôs that. And setting the initial state of x and y is working, at least for this screen, but the values that are getting logged are ‚Ä¶ not correct ‚Ä¶ I mean, it‚Äôs working, but I don‚Äôt know why. When you take the snapshot, though, the image is placed where the numbers say it should go ‚Ä¶ which ‚Ä¶ is nice ‚Ä¶ but the numbers are like way off ‚Ä¶ yea, so total center of the screen is registering ~70 by ~680 ‚Ä¶ The width and height of the screen are 414 by 896 ‚Ä¶ 212, 448 ‚Ä¶ then the image itself is one third the width of the screen ‚Ä¶ so 138 by 138 ‚Ä¶ but top and left could mean that number should be offset by 69 ‚Ä¶ ‚Ä¶ nice. (Shoot me, lol.)

Alright, yes, center is 212 - 69 by 448 - 69. So x is easy. Y ‚Ä¶ how do we get ‚Ä¶ I mean, two thirds, but whyyy?!?! And then, only sort of! EFF! We‚Äôve got to be done here, though, we‚Äôre going to push pixels, and push this project out the damn door, lol. Oh, it‚Äôs started jumping again, too, and the infobox animation is pretty janky again too ‚Ä¶ I wonder if debug being off will help ‚Ä¶ Oh my god, it‚Äôs just going wherever it wants ‚Ä¶ OKAY IF I HOLD IT IN JUST EXACTLY THE MIDDLE, LOL! What a shit-show ‚Ä¶ so it‚Äôs got to be some coefficient of the total dx/dy ‚Ä¶ yes, okay, so ‚Ä¶ the original x and y values minus the current ones, times pixelRatio, minus 69? Oh, it disappeared, oh no, lol ‚Ä¶ nooo, what magic did I do ‚Ä¶ OKAY! CHRIST! subtract y-initial by y, multiply by pixelRatio, subtract THAT from y ‚Ä¶ WHY?! I DON‚ÄôT KNOW, GO ASK DAN ABRAMOV! lol. Fixed it though. Commit ‚Ä¶ wait, let me reinstall the app, run it in non-debug mode, see if it behaves the same, lol. YAAAS!!!

Everything Else

And the animation was smooth! Woot! And while it‚Äôs totally worth feeling jittery to solve the x-y problem, I need to go for a walk now, lol! Dawa doesn‚Äôt want to walk, it‚Äôs a little chilly and raining, and I kind of want to go for a run, but I don‚Äôt want to mess my back or ankle up right now, so just some juggling and time on my feet! Allons!

// Back, and back at it, and Dawa is giving me a bit of a break because it‚Äôs raining ‚Ä¶ fonts is going well ‚Ä¶ viewshot is sometimes not getting the logo, which is a little annoying, so I tried putting it on the outside of the view, but it didn‚Äôt like that, but maybe I just need to delete and reinstall the app? Restart the packager? Sacrafice a lemming? I‚Äôll do it, too.

When Life gives you lemons, don‚Äôt make lemonade. Make Life take the lemons back! Get mad! I don‚Äôt want your damn lemons, what the hell am I supposed to do with these?! Demand to see Life‚Äôs manager! Make Life rue the day it thought it could give Cave Johnson lemons! Do you know who I am? I‚Äôm the man who‚Äôs going to burn your house down! With the lemons! I‚Äôm going to get my engineers to invent a combustable lemon that burns your house down! ‚Äî J. K. Simmons

Yeap, just needed to reinstall the app, lol. Isn‚Äôt this a joy? At least it‚Äôs not Objective-C though. // Oh this is the stupidest thing, why isn‚Äôt the text showing up in the modal? It says it‚Äôs there in the debugger ‚Ä¶ reinstalling ‚Ä¶ Also I just wrote the grossest set of ternaries because I‚Äôve had three cups of coffee and a kombucha today and I cannot be bothered, lol. I just want this finished!! Ahhh!! WHY ISN‚ÄôT THE FUCKING LOGO SHOWING UP?!?!? OR THE FUCKING MODAL TEXT?!?!? Now the logo shows up in the debugger, but only in the caption copy screen, and then still no text.

YAY!

Yay, I did it! I‚Äôm uploading the video I recorded demoing it, and I‚Äôm going to send it to Dave, and I‚Äôm going to be done with it! It‚Äôs not as polished as I wanted, of course, and it did the bug thing where it didn‚Äôt record the logo on the second run, but it did on the first run! GOOD ENOUGH!

YES!

item.title: Big Bad Wolf Here ...
item.description: Sooo, I should probably explain that first part, lol, I‚Äôm not giving my dog heroin, he gets an anti-anxiety medication when I need to give‚Ä¶
item.content:encoded:
Sooo, I should probably explain that first part, lol, I‚Äôm not giving my dog heroin, he gets an anti-anxiety medication when I need to give him a haircut, and today is about finishing things. I need to be the big bad wolf here and finish off his haircut, and finish off this Logoed project, at least as much as it‚Äôs going to get finished off, and I feel bad about not being able to give it all the polish it deserves, but it‚Äôs got to be off my plate before tonight, and tomorrow I need to wake up unburdened. Tomorrow I‚Äôm (likely) going to get a call or an email back with a yes or a no as far as moving on with this job, which is very exciting, but I need to be ready to hit the gas, either way. SO! I‚Äôm going to make a todo list and hop to it!

Let‚Äôs see, trivial stuff out of the way, I randomly got a life insurance check, when they said they weren‚Äôt going to send one, but maybe the claim and the returned premiums are different? I don‚Äôt know, rent is due tomorrow, and I know they‚Äôre going to work with me on it, because unless the federal tax return comes in I‚Äôm not going to make it, but like everyone is out of a job, damn near, because of this whole pandemic thing. Oof, and there was another bill in two days, but I don‚Äôt remember what. There was something on the 10th and something on the 20th ‚Ä¶ eugh! Nnnope, no federal tax return yet. Weird, usually the state one comes later, but I got it a week ago. This sucks, I barely have food in the house. AHHH, lol!

Umm, what other small things, well, just that since I gave Dawa half of the tab of the medicine at 9, somewhere between 11 and 1 will be the window of opportunity there, and I should set the pomodoro timer going so that I can use my time well in here ‚Ä¶ eh, actually, an hour and a half? That‚Äôs like ‚Ä¶ this should be enough time to just bust it out if I‚Äôm working intelligently ‚Ä¶ so the aspect ratio thing, I‚Äôm not going to worry about that. The pendingDrag and logo size, that‚Äôs got to happen. Restructuring the ‚Äòis this you‚Äô modal slightly, and altering the profile creation text, that‚Äôs going to happen. I really want to get the fonts in there, I don‚Äôt think that should take long. Restructuring the business selection screen, that shouldn‚Äôt take too long, and then for presentational purposes I‚Äôll put together the table tent type thing for Leilu. Okay, the animation could be worse, I might play with the timing a bit, but that‚Äôs pretty okay. Have to get the conditional text in there, and decide what to do about either a timed drop of the modal or just a button plus tap-outside or what. Oop, and I need to put the whole moving on thing back together, that‚Äôs just a minute, and then getting the caption to look right, and the button bigger, but that‚Äôll be the same button as the qr code button, and then some sort of feedback, what are we doing there ‚Ä¶ we‚Äôll cross that bridge when we get to it. And then just the next screen needs a little restructuring and there to be only one button at first, and then when you get back and say you did it, we‚Äôll need the loading screen to pop for a second and to create the thank you page and drawer stuff. Oh boy. Okay maybe more than an hour and a half. Maybe not, let‚Äôs see. Oh, and the loading screen at the front of the app, why isn‚Äôt it displaying anything, that needs to have a conditional message, too.

Let‚Äôs take that from the top, why isn‚Äôt the loading screen displaying properly, lol. // Okay, it is, but it‚Äôs showing please log in with Auth0 to use the app ‚Ä¶ what is the presentation going to look like? Let‚Äôs make sure we blow away the async storage thing, and delete the user, and what does that look like ‚Ä¶ oh thank you helpful error messages! There‚Äôs a .remove, who‚Äôd‚Äôa thunk. Mmm, so, .removeItem actually, and shoutout to @TatianaMac suggesting defaulting to searching github rather than google, definitely going to do that more often.

Oh, jeez, my computer is like, heating up, VS Code is stopping working every once and a while ‚Ä¶ lord have mercy ‚Ä¶

Alrighty, two seconds to read the loading screen seems like enough time, maybe I bump it to two and a half, go crazy with it. // Alrighty, profile creation, is this you modal ‚Ä¶ // Okay, put myself together, have another coffee going, what‚Äôs left on the list?

  • pendingDrag and logo size
  • fonts
  • businessSelection screen
  • Leilu table tent
  • play with animation
  • conditional text
  • drop button, use tap-outside for the presentation
  • fix the viewshot flow
  • Instagram post text (plus image?)
  • ShareIt page (plus image?) plus flow
  • Thank you page

Dog time though, go go go! I think it‚Äôs allergies time, too! //

Oh, no! I just got the news that Bernie isn‚Äôt running anymore. We‚Äôre fucked!

The good news is that I got Dawa‚Äôs haircut like 95% done, and that‚Äôs despite me finding the pill he somehow tricked me into thinking he swallowed on the floor, but honestly, I‚Äôm rocked. There was this thread of hope that maybe the government could be nudged back in the right direction, but America is a rolling stone going down, as far as I can tell, now.

The appropriate response would be to lean into it, work harder than ever, get personally involved in local politics in some way, journalism or organizing or running for something, I don‚Äôt know, but honestly the temptation to go buy way too much beer and anaesthatize myself is definitely there. Just when I was doing so well with that, too, lol. No, I‚Äôm not going to do that. I mean, not yet, at least. I‚Äôm going to get some snacks (that were supposed to be for later, but I need a mood boost now,) make some tea, and code. Then I‚Äôm going to get a little mad, because in my head I was thinking, the code doesn‚Äôt care that this is going to hurt a lot of people, but I remembered, what I do with code could make all the difference, and that being a force multiplier is what it‚Äôs all about, and what am I doing with my time and my talents?

Okay, deep breath, sit up, hit build in Xcode, and make some tea ‚Ä¶ which is about how long building this thing in Xcode takes my computer, lol ‚Ä¶ Ahh, everything is running slow, por que?

// Okay, fixing screens, rockin on, time to get the Logoing screen fixed. First, the shutter and logo shouldn‚Äôt be visible until the modal drops ‚Ä¶ no, that‚Äôs fine, speed up the entrance though ‚Ä¶ oh yea! Nice. Now the Leilu logo is invisible as is, time to fix the scale and maybe add a border or background or something.

// Mmm, been at it a while and my brain is starting to numb out ‚Ä¶ I think I got the ternaries in the right place, but setting up the state management for them and whether a snapshot being taken should also saveSnapShot and navigate out is something for when I come back to the computer. Looking good though! Just these last few details of the Logoing screen, then the post-Logoing flow, and maybe putting fonts in, then make the presentation, then ‚Ä¶ try not to think about the news too much, lol!

// Okay, had a bit of a bike ride, back, added an icon for profile creation, tapping a list item submits it, decided I‚Äôm only going to show drag and then snap, not snap and then drag.

// Dog walk number six, complete. My back started hurting as soon as I sat down. Nice. The y value is being set to ridiculously high values now, and I have no idea why. My dog is like, not trying to walk with me now, either, and he‚Äôs totally throwing my back out yanking me all over the place. OW!!

// Maybe tomorrow :(

Best wishes, ~g

item.title: Standing Desk Vibes
item.description: Good morning! Up early enough that the dog isn‚Äôt asking to be taken out yet, good sign. Whoop, speak of the devil :) // Okay, so, I‚Äôm going‚Ä¶
item.content:encoded:
Good morning! Up early enough that the dog isn‚Äôt asking to be taken out yet, good sign. Whoop, speak of the devil :) //

Okay, so, I‚Äôm going to prioritize my tasks and then start the pomodoro timer off, after looking at the code for the pomodoro timer for a moment, because the pair programming exercise, if I get there, (please let me get there!) is going to be in Node, so let‚Äôs look at some Node code.

Node code, bro, whoa! // Oh no, it‚Äôs almost unreadable, lol. Hold on ‚Ä¶ Oh, that‚Äôs nicer. DRY‚Äôed it up a bit, removed a silly dependency, much more readable

Okay, so, Logoed tasks, one by one ‚Ä¶ the splash screen, I‚Äôm going to spin up a test project for that, I still want to get it, but since it might be like a lot of trouble, other things for now. Let‚Äôs get some wins. I don‚Äôt know how I broke the viewshot code, so that‚Äôs high priority, and then the infobox, and then everything else, go! Oh, you know what, the whole aspect ratio thing ‚Ä¶ that‚Äôs number three maybe.

Lol the viewshot code fixed itself. Wtf, lol. Sometimes you just have to wtf. Like this morning, when I woke up, and right then tweaker-man went by ranting about something-or-other.

// Eugh, some GI upset, and I feel like an idiot right now, too. I know I slept Sunday night, but Saturday night and last night, not so much, and I am feelin‚Äô it.

Oh, I didn‚Äôt pass onPress through. I thought I broke everything, lol, but I just took a component out to try and make things more readable.

// Okay, so just spend like an hour wrestling with react-native-modal and the Animated API, and ‚Ä¶ I don‚Äôt know, I can stick with it, and just run the whole animation after the modal has loaded, because the whole ‚Äòtap outside‚Äô thing is no-hassle ‚Ä¶ yea, maybe I‚Äôll do that, either that or just have a seperate modal overlay that‚Äôs always rendered but opaque and tie that to the same animation, but then have to wire up some sort of closing thing ‚Ä¶ still don‚Äôt have an icon that it‚Äôs supposed to disappear into ‚Ä¶ this is surely like, not how to do it, ideally ‚Ä¶ kinda want to reach for a library, but I‚Äôll just press on here and try and make good enough with what I‚Äôve got right now. Dog walking time! üêï

// Bueno! Let‚Äôs see if I can‚Äôt do this thing with react-native-modal ‚Ä¶ okay so I need to set the initial position to way off screen, like all the way to the right and then all the way down plus another screen‚Äôs length (height,) and then so when the modal is going to animate, fade out the icon, then when the modal has animated, zoom and fade the infobox in, then when the modal is going to animate, zoom and fade the infobox out, and then when the modal has animated, fade the icon in. Okay, go!

Lol I was going to make a coffee at one, but I just forgot and kept working. Pomodoro app doesn‚Äôt do much if I don‚Äôt pay attention, lol. Getting in that zone though!

AYY!! Got my first infinite loop error in React Native! Fabulous! It all sorta came together in my mind, and then ‚Ä¶ it didn‚Äôt work, lol. That‚Äôs fine, though, I get to find out why and figure out another way to try it! Or at least find another way to try it!

Wow, okay, so actually I was loading the modal in the background when camera permission was set, and the button in the modal had onPress={functionThatAffectedState()} rather than onPress={() => functionThatAffectedState()} so it was running immediately and causing a rerender loop. Fascinating!

// Sweet, okay, requisitioned some supplies, changed marginBottom to marginTop and the animation makes way more sense now, though it‚Äôs hardly perfect, walked the dog for the fifth time today, his food is warming up, and I‚Äôm exhausted and am going to just pick off some low hanging fruit so that tomorrow I can tackle hopefully the last of the hard stuff tomorrow and that it‚Äôll feel closer to complete will drive me to finish up.

Best wishes, ~g

item.title: Mend It Monday
item.description: I gotta say, after yesterday, I‚Äôm rocked, I haven‚Äôt felt like this in a while ‚Ä¶ feels good, man. Okay, so, big phone call today, or Google‚Ä¶
item.content:encoded:
I gotta say, after yesterday, I‚Äôm rocked, I haven‚Äôt felt like this in a while ‚Ä¶ feels good, man.

Okay, so, big phone call today, or Google Hangouts session ‚Ä¶ in the hangout, going to try to match the verbiage ‚Ä¶ anyway, could be a big day, though the way I see it, there‚Äôs a very small chance that I actually get this job, a decent chance I get flat-out rejected, and a pretty good chance I get some sort of a nebulous answer of either maybe a second interview or a we‚Äôll call you back, maybe, so I‚Äôve got my resume, I know a few places where there are some job listings, and I‚Äôm going to get done with the Logoed thing and move on to this site and Run Club so that the resume will even be accurate, lol, because it says I‚Äôm working on those two currently.

Now, what I should do is take the Pluralsight courses on Git and learn it properly, then dive back in, but what I‚Äôm going to do is make a commit with everything broken, now, look up how to go back and forth between commits properly, make a new branch ‚Äòfix-it‚Äô, and hop back and forth and do my best to get everything working today so I can a) bring my confidence back up before this meeting hangout, and b) move on with my life.

Oh, Thursday ‚Ä¶ oof. Where are the sticky notes ‚Ä¶ there, I‚Äôve done it, first sticky note on the monitor since moving, ‚ÄúCommit early, commit often!‚Äù Will I learn? Who knows.

Oh, wow, though, the top answer on StackOverflow just described checkout, diff, and merge so clearly though ‚Ä¶ How haven‚Äôt I seen that before? Or maybe I have, but now I‚Äôve done enough to know what they‚Äôre saying ‚Ä¶ hmm ‚Ä¶ 83ff97fe22640fb4db97cff1c442626ce4708256 is Thursday‚Äôs commit (‚Äòit went boop!‚Äô) and b973cc9d65455256bd669a79bd0e0dc0815809cf is today‚Äôs commit (‚ÄòI broke everything‚Äô) ‚Ä¶ whoa ‚Ä¶ okay, so, yea, just read through git diff ‚Äîhelp ‚Ä¶ what was much less scary than last time I remember reading any git man pages. Okay, so git diff commit1 commit2 === git diff commit1..commit2, you can use ‚Äîname-only or ‚Äîname-status to get just the file names/names plus statuses, and you can tack on either a file or directory and it will either do the file or any files in the directory. Cool! Or git diff HEAD^ HEAD for the version before the last commit and the last commit, which is what I want ‚Ä¶ okay, so I think package.json, then /ios, /android, and /src ‚Ä¶ ooh, I added cameraroll ‚Ä¶ do I even use that yet? Yes! That saves it to the cameraroll, I was thinking the imagepicker. Oh, cool, I can just do git checkout HEAD^ ‚Ä¶

Okay, it‚Äôs a start, adding @react-native-community/cameraroll, deleted a .xcodeproj/ that randomly showed up, so (cd ios && pod install) works again ‚Ä¶ waiting, lol ‚Ä¶ did I update the permissions in info.plist yet? I needed to change that, anyway ‚Ä¶ oh, I can‚Äôt checkout another branch while that‚Äôs running, lol ‚Ä¶ No updates, oh this is cool! // Oh, that took way less time than I thought it was going to! That took like an hour and fifteen minutes, all told.

Sweet! It built! And it‚Äôs still buggy, but it‚Äôs not that type of buggy! Dog-walking time!

// AAHHHH!!! Interview! Interview went well! Okay at least! I lived through it! Omg! First off, they‚Äôre super-legit, like no kidding, wow. That I was in way over my head became apparent (hopefully more-so to me, lol! ‚Ä¶ maybe not though, also lol) very quickly when he started talking about who was in on the project, both personel and company-wise. Wow though! And so I introduced myself, and I think I forgot to give like any color at all ‚Ä¶ well, that‚Äôs not true, I mentioned how the unpaid internship at Moodbit was like ‚Ä¶ wake up at 3:30, walk the dog, bike to Starbucks and open up at 4:30, work till 12, then bike to the train station, take the train into the city, code till like 6, rinse, repeat, and how the Logoed project ended :(, and that I liked orchids, which apparently the non-technical founder does too ‚Ä¶ but so the coding challenge part, I was like, sooo nervous, omg! He was so nice though, especially because you could tell he was like, trying to get through it and waiting until I stopped talking for a little before nudging me in the right direction ‚Ä¶ that was the wooorst though, omg! I didn‚Äôt remember the do-while syntax, so I used a good ole for loop ‚Ä¶ ahhhh, so not functional! And then I forgot to call the function I wrote, that was soo embarassing, and I called i++ within it, omg ‚Ä¶ nightmare material ‚Ä¶ at least I started it off with a little joke though, the challenge was to print to the console the next thirty leap years, and at least I remembered how to use the modulus operator, and at least I got there, eventually lol, but so I started by typing out console.log(2020); console.log(2024); console.log(2028); and was like, probably not like that, right? Which I hope he found amusing :) Then I was able to ask him some questions and it was like, BOOM! Guess where‚Äôd this come from, who‚Äôs interested, who‚Äôs working here, and I was like oh, jeez, well, nice interviewing with you, but not out loud lol, and so I‚Äôll hear back either tomorrow or Thursday! AAAHHHHHHHH!!!!!

Best wishes!!! ~g

item.title: Mental Health Neigh
item.description: It‚Äôs been a rough week, a rough weekend, yesterday was rough, I didn‚Äôt really sleep last night, so I took a mental health day (in which I‚Ä¶
item.content:encoded:
It‚Äôs been a rough week, a rough weekend, yesterday was rough, I didn‚Äôt really sleep last night, so I took a mental health day (in which I managed to work my butt off.) Also my sister sent me pictures of her husband and their kids on ‚Ä¶ well, battery powered unicorns and horses? With the sticks, you know what I‚Äôm talking about, you hop about as if you‚Äôre riding horses, it‚Äôs a good time. HENCE, it‚Äôs a mental health neigh. :)

I was pretty seriously depressed this morning. Most of the time, at least in recent memory, I‚Äôve been more-or-less able to keep it together. This morning started off not great though. So I thought of the things I wanted to get done, and then I decided to get the things done that really mattered, and that meant getting up, making a nice cup of coffee on the French press, getting the couple of dishes done, walking Dawa, eating a breakfast salad, writing a letter to my niece, getting a workout in (day three of #coronalMassEjection!) and giving Dawa an anti-anxiety pill, which meant after the workout I was able to put myself together, have some granola and soy milk, and spend the next like three hours cutting Dawa‚Äôs hair and trying to get his nails done. It is a process. Like, it‚Äôs a haircut where you‚Äôve got to stop and get some lunch and another coffee in the middle. Lunch was beans and rice, and the coffee was eighty grams a grande on the French press by the Hoffman technique, but ground for French press rather than metal, because I didn‚Äôt want to bother with another round of decanting the silt out this time.

Sooo, I find myself unable to bring myself to finish the last ten percent of Dawa‚Äôs haircut (much like the last ten percent of the coding project I should be working on, says a part of my brain,) and with excellent nutrition and a lot of caffeine in me, and I decide to find a trail. I‚Äôd been mulling it over, but I was talking with the nice lady with the two little dogs, Lola and Pepper, down at the dog park, and getting just a little bit of socialization (from a distance!) in, and asking about the bridge to Groton, where I‚Äôd seen on a map that there were some trails within a reasonable distance, and she said there was a pedestrian-slash-bike path, well that did it, it‚Äôs Sunday, I‚Äôd find the trail and next weekend, if I‚Äôd done well this coming week, I‚Äôd have something to look forward to doing, so I packed some water, glanced at the map for general directions, and headed out.

Skip ahead to the nice officer informing me, halfway across, that you can‚Äôt just bike across the bridge (I95,) and me responding yes, thank you, this doesn‚Äôt look anything like the bike path, him asking me whether I was from New London, me saying I‚Äôd just moved here and had heard that there was, him rolling his eyes and proceeding to explain in depth how there was a pedestrian-slash-bike path on the north side of the bridge, though notably without good directions to or instructions on how to find the entrances to this path beyond ‚Äòask someone,‚Äô but there we have it, and he was nice enough to escort me across the rest of the bridge with his lights on, rolling along in the shoulder behind me at a good twenty, twenty-five miles an hour, and I waved as I exited and chalked it up to another biking on a bridge adventure, and ask me about the others in person and not in writing if you don‚Äôt mind, but so eventually I got to Groton.

And oohhh, Nelly are there some nice trails a couple miles in, there!! It‚Äôs not like, expansive, as far as trail networks go, but that‚Äôs the stuff! Single-track, rocks, roots, roller-coaster little hills, brooks to jump over, occasional mountain bikers to overtake, and some real nature! I just don‚Äôt feel myself when I can‚Äôt feel like a ‚Ä¶ oh, that word has some negative connotations ‚Ä¶ savage is only sort of what I mean, and invoking ‚Äòlike an animal‚Äô doesn‚Äôt really improve matters ‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs so important to me, but I lack the vocabulary to talk about it in a way that invokes the feeling of really being a part of the natural world around oneself in a non-problematic way, and to at once say that it‚Äôs indicative of a problem in society today, and to segue with something possibly equally problematic, forty-five minutes later found me screaming like a little girl.

I‚Äôd forgotten that I was afraid of heights, and, when I finally used Google Maps to navigate me to the pedestrian-slash-bike path (which was hardly marked at all, and also Google took me down absolutely-not-a-bike-path to get there at one point!) I found myself on a pathway that varied from three to sometimes two feet wide with a several hundred foot drop on the side that wasn‚Äôt Jersey barrier, and the seperation between you and that was a series of thin vertical iron bars, with nothing horizontal happening anywhere between the very bottom and ten feet up. Think of the last time you went by some barrier that consisted of just vertical slits, and how they tend to just visually disappear. Basically the experience was of careening along a narrow path, at speed, with certain death looming and drawing you in, as the abyss tends to, on one side. Whoever designed this was an @$$hole. I think the one gentleman also using the path correctly read my genuine terror and chuckled a bit at or with me. After clenching my handlebars and the seat with my hands and thighs, screaming, ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt want to be here!‚Äù ‚ÄúWho would do such a thing! (Designing it this way)‚Äù and good ole‚Äô, ‚ÄúAAAHHHHHAHAHAHAAAHAAAAA!!!!!‚Äù I exited, marked where the entrance was, and, swearing I‚Äôd never go back, marked the spot in my memory for the next time I‚Äôll go to the trail across the bridge in Groton.

Now to finish putting the chicken I‚Äôve just made down for Dawa, posting this, and winding down for the night, and tomorrow I‚Äôve got a very important phone call, could stand to finish up the rest of Dawa‚Äôs haircut, and could probably stand to enjoy some of the sixty degrees and sunshine with him, poor little guy, and we‚Äôll figure out the coding thing and the financial thing and the computer part thing (anyone own an extremely small pair of needlenose pliers?) with a head that‚Äôs ready to reason things through calmly and rationally, in a more grounded manner, so to speak.

For now, best wishes! ~g

item.title: Coronal Mass Ejection
item.description: Okay, so first off, #coronalMassEjection is my new hashtag for losing weight put on during the Coronavirus pandemic. Quarantine getting in‚Ä¶
item.content:encoded:
Okay, so first off, #coronalMassEjection is my new hashtag for losing weight put on during the Coronavirus pandemic. Quarantine getting in the way of getting fit and lean? Self isolation getting in the way of self care? Coronavirus have you going up a couple sizes? Being good about washing your hands but finding it hard to fit into your pants? #coronalMassEjection. This is day two for me, since a few days ago I tried going for a run and my Achilles acted up 4.2 miles in because I haven‚Äôt really been training and have put on like ten pounds, so yesterday I worked out in my apartment, and today I went for a nice long bike ride ‚Ä¶ and then, oh boy, got the laundry done, dishes done, bathroom cleaned, sofa de-dusted, vacuuming done, dog walked well, recycling out, and I ate spinach for breakfast, some granola and soy milk to recover for the ride, and then rice and beans for lunch ‚Ä¶ but have I done any coding yet today, when I meant to have the Logoed thing finished up this morning? Nope, lol. But I‚Äôve got food in me, a coffee here, and a clean apartment, which really helps me think clearly. When I‚Äôm inspired, I can galaxy-brain right through total chaos, but these days so often I have to like ‚Ä¶ work to use my brain, lol. So here goes!

I think I should look through how the app is right now and get the goals to get it to good enough, as well as throw in some nice-to-haves and definitely-todos, and then I can have the list in order to get this version done enough to show off the design-y bits to Dave, and then some stuff to work on to get the thing more polished for a portfolio piece, and then like the major todos for if Dave actually wants me back on the project, or to give to the devs on the project now along with the code, whatever, you know?

Okay, deep breaths, some coffee, time to look at what I built with a critical eye.

  • Loading. Splash screen is an ugly color with ugly text, it‚Äôs not on brand.
  • No time to read the instructions to please log in with Auth0.
  • No Logoed logo in universal signup
  • Header title too small, no fonts loaded
  • Profile Creation and Just your Instagram handle should just be one thing, no need for a title (see later, maybe a title would be good,) and a please would go a long way. YourAwesomeInsta! is stupid. A blank avatar picture would help people get the idea quickly.
  • You know, if it was half-price apps, there‚Äôd be no reason to spam, like you could just use another email and instagram account to spam for raffle tickets if you were so inclined, unless we built in anomaly detection for it.
  • The text input is too long, and not tall enough. The gray for the placeholder and disabled button should be the same. I wonder what dark orange on the header would look like, or a linear gradient.
  • If the whole thing was up higher, you could have just some texture down on the bottom to make it look better, and then it wouldn‚Äôt seem like it was jumping so much to avoid the keyboard.
  • It needs to remove trailing spaces, there shouldn‚Äôt be any trailing spaces. Can you have Instagram handles with spaces in them?
  • The text input outline and button color should be the same blue.
  • The spinner should be even bigger, and spin longer to simulate the network request properly.
  • The handle and the picture should be connected, then the prompt, then the buttons, and the buttons should be differentiated, maybe side-by-side, one blue one red or gray.
  • This is where using the header title seems like good standard practice to follow, though again the font and font size and weight, and background color.
  • The prompt needs rewriting and seperating, heirarchically and by font size, maybe a seperator.
  • The sub-prompt needs to be more concise.
  • The text input is too wide and not tall enough, and the whole list item needs to be a tap target. Tapping outside the keyboard needs to close it. Return should submit.
  • The list needs to be recognizable as such. Maybe a border, maybe subtle backgrounds for the businesses, maybe seperators.
  • The button for the list select needs to be again, the same color, and disabled when there‚Äôs nothing there. Also maybe in-line.
  • The scan qr code button needs to be seperated from the list, and an icon would go a long way, along with an actual button-looking-button.
  • How about your Insta profile pic at the top left? Opening the drawer? ‚Ä¶ nooo ‚Ä¶
  • The logo shouldn‚Äôt render until the camera has access permission. Don‚Äôt distract.
  • The logo isn‚Äôt denoted as draggable. I think if it was put where the cameraroll box usually is, and if you could animate a glowing backlight for it either when the snapshot is taken, or the info-box icon is tapped, and make it small until it‚Äôs dragged onto the canvas. Also, it should snap into bounds. Also, it should stop moving when you let go! Also it should be in the same place it was in when you take the snapshot!
  • The shutter is crammed against the bottom.
  • The info-box hasn‚Äôt been built yet.
  • The aspect ratio for my phone‚Äôs camera means that it‚Äôs going to get cropped to get posted. Maybe just have there be opaque bars indicating what part of the camera is going to be used.
  • The message for accessing the photos is wrong, it should be so you can save your image and post it to Instagram.
  • The Logoed image should be in the caption copy screen. The only action taken on this screen should be to copy the caption, but hammer it in: THIS PHOTO, THIS CAPTION, ENTER RAFFLE THIS WAY.
  • Don‚Äôt say please, start with the verb. Polite time was earlier, they need to do the thing now.
  • Header title, ‚ÄúCopy Caption‚Äù. Back button doesn‚Äôt need to be enabled, swiping is enabled.
  • The caption should look like an Instagram caption.
  • I know we‚Äôve had instructions on top, previously, so look this back over, but I imaging having the image, then the caption, then a big button, then the instructions would be best here, so the big button is closer to the center of the screen. Also, it needs feedback to show that an action was taken by hitting the button, not just navigating to the next screen. Like, scale, color change, tooltip, whole nine yards.
  • No back button on the share screen. Get a visual gist, copy the caption, get the visual gist again, get the verbal instruction, off to Instagram. Header title, ‚ÄúShare to Instagram‚Äù.
  • No two buttons! We‚Äôre trying to move away from it being cluttered. Same setup as before, gist of the post, big button, instructions. Maybe set state when you hit the botton to go to Instagram that another button shows up, and that takes you to the app drawer, and gives another opportunity for them to see the instructions, in case their drunk asses navigated away and then were like, ‚Äòwhaaat?‚Äô
  • Where‚Äôs the thank you screen, hamburger menu, all that jazz, buddy? Got some work to do?

Okay, when I start being snarky at myself, I‚Äôve spent long enough in critique mode. Some of these things are like, actually majorly hard, like the flipping draggable element, why isn‚Äôt it working, good lord, then there‚Äôs some stuff that‚Äôs legit hard but I could probably do, like the maximum aspect ratio for Instagram posts and the viewport bars, then there‚Äôs some hard stuff I think I can do, like the info-box thing, though getting it nice could be tricky, and then there‚Äôs a whole lot of easy-to-medium difficulty stuff that I can pick off as I go, oh, and I forgot everything around handling the error states ‚Ä¶ that‚Äôs a big maybe there. Okay, anyway, there‚Äôs the set of things to do, at least on the front-end, and then there‚Äôs describing why it‚Äôs better than before, and then there‚Äôs describing what would happen on the back-end ‚Ä¶ except the video should go like, Hi, hope y‚Äôall are well, when I left off, there were some problems with the design, and I had thought the web app was the way to go, I thought of some solutions for the design and built it into a native app, which I‚Äôll show to you now, but first, I made this from like scratch in a week and learned the latest version of the screen-to-screen navigation system and this whole other pretty big structural change to the framework along the way, so thank you for the opportunity, but if there are some rough edges, please try and stay focused on the changes in design to make things easier for the user and for us to keep track of things, and secondly, there are two places where I make it seem like the app is talking to our server and doing things, but that‚Äôs hard-coded in just to illustrate the user experience. I‚Äôll talk about those along the way, let‚Äôs get started though. Okay, first, they‚Äôve got to download the app, and the qr code should send them to the app store or google play store if everything is set up properly, or they can go to them and search for Logoed, either way, that‚Äôs a little hurdle, but after upgrading my phone and seeing apps download faster, I‚Äôm not convinced it‚Äôs as big of one. Moving on, I‚Äôm using the service Auth0 to sign the user in or up here, and it keeps an access token in memory for a day so they‚Äôre logged back in if they open the app back up, and that‚Äôs the first identifier for the user. (Moving on.) Second, we should get their Instagram handle, and then we‚Äôve got everything we need to keep track of who‚Äôs who and what‚Äôs happening, and if we have multiple email addresses trying to be one Instagram account or an email address trying to be an Instragram account that‚Äôs taken, that can be handled. Now this little verification step is the first place where our back-end would have to do something, namely get their input and go to instagram.com/whatever-they-typed-in, check if it‚Äôs an actual profile page, and if it is, look for this little bit of information, the url for their profile picture, which it‚Äôs not actually doing right here, I just found the url for mine and threw it in there. This should allow the user to quickly recognize they did it right and hopefully enforce the whole gist of what‚Äôs happening here. Okay, moving on to the business select, and so if they‚Äôre hitting the app through the qr code and have already downloaded the app and have signed in and have put their Instagram handle in, it should be able to automatically skip this part, and if you hit the scan the qr code button, it‚Äôll go through without having to even leave the app, or if they want to search with a text input or scroll down a list, there‚Äôs that. This part is going to need to evolve based on the number of businesses signed up for Logoed, because you don‚Äôt want a list with a thousand businesses on it, you‚Äôll want to narrow it down by location, or however that‚Äôs figured out. For the moment they can live next to eachother here, and both will get you to the next screen with the right logo. Moving on, so this little pop-up is one of the major improvements, because there were like four different things going on in the Logoing screen before, we had the shutter which never went away, a cameraroll box, the logo, and instructions that never went away, and now there‚Äôs the shutter, which goes away, and the logo, and the instructions kind of go away too into that little icon, which if we tap again ‚Ä¶ will bring them up in case the user needs them, but they‚Äôre more or less out of the way. You‚Äôll probably notice dragging the logo and where it‚Äôs placed when you take the snapshot are a little off, but that‚Äôs like probably several days of work to figure out a solution for, or a lucky guess, I don‚Äôt know, I tried a few things but just wanted to get the general idea of how the flow of things could be communicated. Anyway, the next screen has just the one action, copy the caption, which we‚Äôll remember is how we can search for posts, because you can search for as many @mentions as a business on their platform as you want, but a limited number of hashtags per week or whatever, and then once you have the id of that post, you‚Äôre golden and can see if it‚Äôs actually of food and the logo hasn‚Äôt been taken out or whatever. So, yea, this screen, you‚Äôve got the image and the caption together, they should be getting the gist, and they hit the copy caption button and it tells them like, an action has been taken, something happened, caption copied to clipboard, good job, then moving on, and again, one action on this screen, you‚Äôve got the image and the caption, big button, clear concise instructions, hopefully they get the idea, and it‚Äôs off to Instagram. Posting ‚Ä¶ bing ‚Ä¶ bang ‚Ä¶ boom ‚Ä¶ Okay, now back to the app, here we‚Äôve got a big button to confirm that they did it, or they somehow forgot what they were doing and need to go back, and here‚Äôs the second piece where it looks like the back-end is confirming that the image and caption were posted properly, but I‚Äôm just hard-coding it in to illustrate what should happen, okay and so here‚Äôs where they land, and we can thank them and let them know they‚Äôve entered the raffle at Waffle House or wherever they are, and here they can find anything else they might need to find and we might need to include, like a feedback form, a place to list other businesses you can use Logoed at, the status of their raffle entry or maybe qr codes for half-priced appetizers, whatever their reward is, terms of service, all that jazz. Okay, so that‚Äôs the gist, hopefully your team can use this, or not, anyway it‚Äôs been nice working on this, stay well and best wishes, peace!

Oh boy, okay, so let‚Äôs see if the spash screen works ‚Ä¶ I just made the one asset for my phone and only did like half of the Android setup because MainActivity changed ‚Ä¶ oh, shoot, build failed ‚Ä¶ ahhh ‚Ä¶ anything that Xcode touches, or having to delve into any of that part of things, what a nightmare. EUGH, I have 120 errors, but none of them are from react-native-splash-screen! And they‚Äôre all yellow warnings, not red errors, at least there you know what‚Äôs what ‚Ä¶ :( Okay, cleaning the build folder gave me more errors, upgrading the build target gave me less ‚Ä¶ now I‚Äôm at 124 ‚Ä¶

And now my .xcodeworkspace is pointing to an assets folder because I don‚Äôt really know how to use Xcode, and I don‚Äôt know when the last commit was, and I‚Äôm going to throw my hands in the air as far as this is concerned, fo‚Äôrizzle, until tomorrow morning when we sticky-note ‚ÄúCOMMIT EARLY, COMMIT OFTEN‚Äù to my monitor, nuke the project, and rebuild from scratch! Holey moley! Maybe I‚Äôll try booting the other machine up now I have the hard drive cable, and maybe there will be something new and good going on. Oooof!

Tell me why I have toothpicks in a clamp and a seperate pair of needlenose pliers trying to make a smaller pair of needlenose pliers though. Done, good night.

Best wishes, ~g

item.title: Yet Another Day
item.description: Good morning! Meant to be up at five, but resident tweaker-man wandered by barking swearwords at a quarter to, so up we got! Today it was, s‚Ä¶
item.content:encoded:
Good morning! Meant to be up at five, but resident tweaker-man wandered by barking swearwords at a quarter to, so up we got! Today it was, s#!% man, f%*@#ing stupid-@&& lawers ‚Ä¶ eep, lol.

I had some dishes to do anyway. Nothing like cleaning when you‚Äôre angry. Take it out on the dirt, not your neighbors :) Made a delicious cup of coffee, too. Got the French presses clean and opened a fresh bag of a Costa Rican/Latin American blend, and brewed fifty-five grams using the Hoffman method, and it came out perfectly.

On to coding, I‚Äôm going to recap a bit, because I‚Äôve already been at it for like forty-five minutes here, I figured out the react-native-draggable thing! So, I‚Äôve got to keep the x and y values of the draggable element in state, because ‚Ä¶ hmm, well now that I‚Äôm making the images full-screen ‚Ä¶ well, before I was making the images square because we thought we could send them right over to Instagram like that, now I don‚Äôt know if I need to keep x and y in state for getting the composite image of the photo and logo ‚Ä¶ and it might maintain position between navigation, too, I just really don‚Äôt know, anyway, at the moment I‚Äôm using the onDragRelease event and running setXY({ e, gestureState }), but just saying setX(x + Math.round(gestureState.dx)) and setY the same way was sending the element off into the woods, and moveX/moveY just turned out to be the absolute values, and then I looked up ReactNative.PixelRatio, tried getPixelSizeForLayoutSize, which set it off to the moon, and then I looked down at the actual API and there‚Äôs a .get(), so the solution ended up being just const pixelRatio = PixelRatio.get(); setX(x + gestureState.dx / pixelRatio), and I keep typing pixelRation, lol ‚Ä¶ anyway, it‚Äôs a little wonky, but it seems to work better than anything else ‚Ä¶ except possibly just not managing it, but I haven‚Äôt quite got to the snapshot part yet.

At the moment, the camera is definitely working, and the shutter is definitely doing the thing, but then the image isn‚Äôt displaying, and also it takes like, more than a second for it to figure itself out, so something is amiss there. Also, I can only get the shutter to render by putting text in it, which is annoying. I‚Äôll probably tackle that first, it‚Äôs not the most important, but like, come on. Render a circle. Render it.

‚Ä¶ That was easy. Empty <View />. Bada-bing. Now where‚Äôs this image going?

Lol, episode three hundred and forty-three of Gareth Is A Silly Goose, I was setting width and height props, it‚Äôs style={{ width: width, height: height }} ‚Ä¶ oh, that‚Äôs a beautiful thing, look at that! Woot! Next up, why isn‚Äôt the draggable element the restaurant logo? Oh, jeez, and I keep on blinding myself by switching over to the browser in light mode ‚Ä¶ ahhh.

Ayy, there it is! ‚Ä¶ Why did that work? Undefined ‚Ä¶ hmm ‚Ä¶ yaaay it worked! First off, business was the route param, restaurant was the object with the logo, and I just needed to tack on a [0] to the filter!

Lol, CameraRoll has been removed from React Native and now we‚Äôre using @react-native-community/cameraroll ‚Ä¶ take your eye off it for a second and it changes, good ole React Native :)

Sweet, okay, CameraRoll working, ViewShot working, I just need the Draggable in there ‚Ä¶ or to render in another Image at that x and y ‚Ä¶ is that why we needed to keep track of the x and y? I‚Äôm not super certain I ever got this right the last time I made this in React Native, actually, I think that was one of the reasons I went with the PWA, lol.

Okay, now do I need to set position: relative on the parent <View>? Nope! Working! Oh ‚Ä¶ so close ‚Ä¶ The image is showing up like a little up and to the right of the draggable element. I wonder if moving draggy-doo inside the viewshot view will do it to it. Starting to lose it a little here, might be time to walk Dawa. Okay, SWEET, could do it with the draggable element, conditionally rendering it along side the camera, all that jazz, just it‚Äôs still like ten pixels up and to the right, and I have no idea why, but it‚Äôs saving it to the camera roll, and I‚Äôm going to map out the states of this screen next and do the whole infobox thing that was like, the main thing I was doing all of this to show off, lol. Lot of learning though! // Okay, well, dog walked, and I think I‚Äôve got to get a workout in or my body is going to rebel ‚Ä¶

// Alright, dope, got a workout in, put myself together, tried to walk the dog ‚Ä¶

‚Ä¶ and got my own walk in to get some snacks and think through the rest of the day.

Basically, I‚Äôm going to finish up the Logoing screen and just fudge the ten pixels thing, maybe try and fix the slight jank of the draggable component, get the info box thing going, get the next few screens written, hard-code the profile creation image, and then I‚Äôm going to make a video about what‚Äôs changed, why it‚Äôs better, how the flow goes, where the server side needs to do its magic, and then hopefully Dave‚Äôs people can take it and run with it, if he‚Äôs paying them and they know good sense when they see it. Who knows. Hopefully then I‚Äôll never have to add a logo to anything ever again though. I‚Äôm only going to put as much polish on it as I can get to by the end of the day today, though, because I need to be working on something else now. Maybe Run Club. Who knows. Or if Dave wants to pay me, fabulous, back to freelancing. Ready, set, go!

// Well ‚Ä¶ that was going well ‚Ä¶ why isn‚Äôt the silly logo staying in place for takeSnapShot?! Ahhh, lol.

// Whoa, okay, lost myself in it for a while. At this point I‚Äôm starting to lose it a little, and I think I should probably push finishing up to tomorrow morning ‚Ä¶ which made me look back at the code I was working on, and I think I know why that wasn‚Äôt rendering, I need a seperate block for conditionally rendering the modal of checkPost type. Okay, well, long overdue on walking Dawa, little trooper.

Oh also though, the linking URI worked! What! It wasn‚Äôt working last time I checked! Miiiight have to rethink whether the image needs to be made square.

Hopefully I will wake up with some answers and some motivation tomorrow! Sleeping in (until six :)!

Best wishes! ~g

item.title: A Day
item.description: AHH!!! Okay, shake it out, code it out, code it up, let‚Äôs do it up! I‚Äôve got this phone call at 1 o‚Äôclock today and the anticipation is‚Ä¶
item.content:encoded:
AHH!!! Okay, shake it out, code it out, code it up, let‚Äôs do it up!

I‚Äôve got this phone call at 1 o‚Äôclock today and the anticipation is tangible! I‚Äôm going to work on Logoed until then, and then I promised Dawa a bike ride! Hope for the best, prepare for the worst, if this goes well it could literally change my life, if it doesn‚Äôt, it needs to not be the end of the world. Inhale. Exhale. :)

Where were we with Logoed? Just handled the new dependencies and imports, time to try and convert the Logoing screen to a functional component and get that information box to icon thing working, which is like 90% of the reason I‚Äôm working on this project again. Crazy how you can just wake up with your brain on fire sometimes!

Oh, wait, navigation first. I guess I don‚Äôt really need to be using context there, but I‚Äôll want that wired up when actual user data happens, maybe I‚Äôll just leave it, though the ProfileCreation and Logoing stacks can get combined. // Oh maybe not though, I can‚Äôt see where to conditionally pass in an initialRoute ‚Ä¶ I guess if the ProfileCreation screen rendered null until it checked for the piece of context ‚Ä¶ You know, let me see if it checks the parent navigator for a screen named BusinessSelection, I imagine that‚Äôs a better way of doing this ‚Ä¶ Nnnope, not BusinessSelection ‚Ä¶ Oh, lol, doesn‚Äôt have to navigate at all, it needs to set the context, herp derp ‚Ä¶ which ‚Ä¶ is not conditionally rendering the Logoing stack ‚Ä¶ maybe it‚Äôs part of the root stack though? Weird! Only the other screen that wasn‚Äôt part of that block is accessible! Oh, whoa, pop isn‚Äôt working either. Wait but if I set a useContext to be fired by instagramHandle[0], RootStack rerenders? I‚Äôve got to restart the packager and reinstall the app to make sure that‚Äôs not a bug. Nope, it was a bug, lol, it‚Äôs definitely calling that function, but not rerendering ‚Ä¶ Oh whhhyyy, okay, let me try and change this ‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm changing the useState function, the setState in useEffect, the value passed to the Provider, which is where I think it might break, and I‚Äôll try passing the whole array if it does ‚Ä¶ and the condition in the return statement ‚Ä¶ oh wait, I‚Äôm not going to change the value passed to the provider.

Oh, yea, no, it did not like that. Oh boy ‚Ä¶ Okay, so

Context and Conditional Rendering

This works, I‚Äôm not super sure why:

ProfileCreationContext

import { createContext } from 'react'; export const ProfileCreationContext = createContext(null);

Navigation

import { ProfileCreationContext } from '../contexts'; const RootStack = createStackNavigator(); const RootStackScreen = () => { const instagramHandle = useState(null); useEffect(() => { instagramHandle[1](instagramHandle[0]); }, [instagramHandle[0]]); return ( <ProfileCreationContext.Provider value={instagramHandle}> <RootStack.Navigator> { instagramHandle[0] ? ( <RootStack.Screen name="LogoingStack" component={LogoingStackScreen} /> ) : ( <RootStack.Screen name="ProfileCreationStack" component={ProfileCreationStackScreen} /> ) } ... ... ) }

ProfileCreation

import { ProfileCreationContext } from '../contexts'; export const ProfileCreation = ({ navigation, route }) => { const [instagramHandle, setInstagramHandle] = useContext(ProfileCreationContext); ‚Ä¶ Oh, wait, ProfileCreation doesn‚Äôt need that context any more ‚Ä¶

Modal

import { ProfileCreationContext } from '../contexts'; export const Modal = ({ navigation, route }) => { const { type } = route.params; const [instagramHandle, setInstagramHandle] = useContext(ProfileCreationContext); return ( <TouchableOpacity onPress={() => setInstagramHandle(route.params.handle)}> ) }

‚Ä¶ putting whitespace in backticks in markdown gets formatted out on save ‚Ä¶ herp derp ‚Ä¶

WAIT NO IT DOESN‚ÄôT WORK?!?! WHAAAT?!?!?! I swear, if removing the console.log broke it ‚Ä¶

Oooohkay, it‚Äôs a race condition between the parent rerendering the stack and the onPress function running. Maybe. Sometimes it works with a 35ms setTimeout, sometimes it doesn‚Äôt. 40ms is acceptable. Wtf though. Okay:

Modal

import { ProfileCreationContext } from '../contexts'; export const Modal = ({ navigation, route }) => { const { type } = route.params; const [instagramHandle, setInstagramHandle] = useContext(ProfileCreationContext); return ( <TouchableOpacity onPress={() => { setInstagramHandle(route.params.handle); setTimeout(() => { navigation.navigate({ name: "LogoingStack" }); }, 40) }}> ) }

Crazy. I feel like if I had more experience writing promise generators I‚Äôd do something with those here ‚Ä¶ or something, I don‚Äôt know ‚Ä¶ so hacky!! Anyway, now to tackle the Logoing screen ‚Ä¶ or walk Dawa again lol. // Well, I had a nice walk and a juggle ‚Ä¶ I took Dawa out, but it‚Äôs windy, so he was afraid and we went back in. Sigh. On to coding!

Well, I‚Äôve definitely grown as a developer, because there‚Äôs no way I would have written code like the old Logoing screen today. Whoa. Big oof. Pen and paper time for the layout. And another walk. //

Amazing how much a walk can do. Before all the code had just kinda started to blend together, now I think I get the heirarchy, what needs to happen onSnapShot, and I‚Äôm going to just go with the React Native flex implementation with inline styles rather than try and figure out how to get the same effect with styled-components ‚Ä¶ for the moment. I‚Äôve got an hour, it would be dope if I can get this working. //

Well in epidsode three hundred and forty two of Gareth Is A Silly Goose, apparently Calendly sends Google Calendar invites with a Google Hangout link, so, lesson learned, and ‚Ä¶ call? rescheduled. I thought the email back with my phone number would have done it, but I bet that the person sending the Calendly invite was aware of how it worked and didn‚Äôt get any prompts to prompt me to check my Google Calendar invites. Or maybe I live under a rock. I‚Äôm back and forth between feeling like the embodiment of ‚ÄúOnce Down Is No Battle,‚Äù and feeling really, really shitty, so I‚Äôm going to dive back into this React Native project so that it‚Äôs the RSOD telling me I‚Äôm shitty and not my own head. External forces are easier to deal with.

Best wishes, ~g

item.title: Z-Day
item.description: Ahh so much! First and WOW I got contacted by a startup that‚Äôs hiring!!! They‚Äôre a React/React Native/Node shop, and want to build a diverse‚Ä¶
item.content:encoded:
Ahh so much! First and WOW I got contacted by a startup that‚Äôs hiring!!! They‚Äôre a React/React Native/Node shop, and want to build a diverse, inclusive team!!! I need to hope for the best and prepare for the worst, of course, but OMG!!! My fingers are crossed!

Okay, second, last night I was like, sure computer, you want to upgrade the operating system, go for it, and today I woke up to bash being deprecated, which umm ‚Ä¶ whole new world here, lol. I installed oh-my-zsh and pasted in my .bash_profile, and it doesn‚Äôt seem too‚Ä¶ different, I haven‚Äôt tried to run a React Native project yet. Eep. So many plugins though! Very temped to install the Chuck Norris and Cat-speak ones.

Here goes ‚Ä¶ hope it works! If I can get what I want to get done on the Logoed project before talking to this person, that would be awesooome ‚Ä¶ this is React Native we‚Äôre talking about though, so I‚Äôve got time to make and eat a salad and make another coffee before it loads, lol.

Sahweet! Course I was greeted with an error, and I‚Äôm not sure what I did to break it, but game on!

I‚Äôm going to post this up, I‚Äôm so stoked, and there‚Äôs a shortage of good news these days, heh ‚Ä¶ WOOT though!!!

// Lol, so I fixed the bug right before the tweaker guy went by yelling. Fml, lol.

Awesome, though, Got to the Logoing screen. Which I still have to build, but I‚Äôve built it before, this won‚Äôt be too difficult, he says, lol. Come to Connecticut, they said. It‚Äôs a little quieter, they said.

Uh-oh, no ruby ‚Ä¶ save me homebrew you‚Äôre my only hope? Yay! Also, thanks everyone in the GitHub issues! brew install cocoapods ruby && brew link --overwrite cocoapods did it for me!

Hmm, I broke the ProfileCreation screen ‚Ä¶ when did I do that? Whooaah, it just lagged massively ‚Ä¶ weird, lol. Whaaat and an affirmative response didn‚Äôt load the BusinessSelection screen! Wait, I should do that whole thing differently anyway, hold on ‚Ä¶ lol, though reloading the JavaScript bundle fixed all the glitches ‚Ä¶ come on :)

Hmm, so this is interesting ‚Ä¶ currently, the root navigator relies on Context to render either the ProfileCreation stack, which itself only has one screen, navigates to the Modal within the root navigator for a confirmation screen, and then either sets the Context so that the Logoing stack is displayed, or doesn‚Äôt if the response from the modal isn‚Äôt affirmative, and then I was like, well this should clearly just navigate to the BusinessSelection screen on affirmative, but it‚Äôs not in the same stack ‚Ä¶ which, I should try it, might actually just work based on react-native navigate actions tending to fall back to the level above if it doesn‚Äôt find a screen with that name, but that‚Äôs a silly way of doing it if being explicit about it is just as easy.

ANOTHER company reached out! WHOA!!! SOOO stressful answering the salary question though! I asked Reactiflux about it, maybe they have some words of reassurance :)

Anyone ever feel extremely uncomfortable answering the, ‚ÄúWhat do you expect your salary to be?‚Äù question? I‚Äôve never really had an actually salaried job in tech, just a freelance gig or two, and I think I‚Äôm, like, okay, but compared to the minimum wage that I‚Äôm used to working retail (doing my best! :slight_smile: ) the amount that I feel I should be responding to this question with just feels absolutely ludicrous ‚Ä¶ Like ‚Ä¶ I basically just wrote a number down that I pulled out of my ‚Ä¶ pulled out of the back of my mind remembering the State of JavaScript survey and divided by 12, and even then I lowered it twice before actually sending the message ‚Ä¶ like ‚Ä¶ a pat on the back and a crust of bread every once and a while would probably seem like too much, and I know, I know, rent, but holy moley ‚Ä¶ is this really the world we‚Äôre living in? Like, I‚Äôve been working at this when I can for like six years now, but it doesn‚Äôt feel real, you know? ‚Äî Twitchkidd

Ooof, where was I? Ahh, there‚Äôs only so much daylight here, dog-walking time again!

// Okay, this has turned into a tomorrow morning question. There‚Äôs only so much being out in the cold I can take. It‚Äôs April, definitely ready for some Spring-like temperatures. The orchid is budding, though! This in parting:

And best wishes, ~g

item.title: Paperwork Day
item.description: Oooof. Batched a bunch of phone calls this morning, and it absolutely sapped my mental energy for the day. Communicating with a very small‚Ä¶
item.content:encoded:
Oooof. Batched a bunch of phone calls this morning, and it absolutely sapped my mental energy for the day. Communicating with a very small number of other people about something we are enthusiastic about boosts my energy, communicating with a large number, (lol, nine,) about things none of us are enthusiastic about ‚Ä¶ nothing quite like it to suck the life force out of me.

Handled that, treated the dog well, ate healthy food and kept the kitchen clean, and I cannot wait for tomorrow morning when I know where I stand, financially and in terms of responsibilities, and can dig back in and rock and roll.

On a positive note, I thought to myself today, imagine if I‚Äôd tried to actually get a serious job as a dev a year ago? I‚Äôve gotten so much better, and if I can push through, even though we‚Äôre kinda on the edge right now, Dawa and I, my little fam, it‚Äôs looking like 2020 is going to be the year of getting our **** together. There‚Äôs a lot to be excited about, but I‚Äôm totally tapped for to ‚Ä¶ day ‚Ä¶ as the upstairs neighbor burns something and sets the smoke alarm off, lol. Hoping the apartment people have another unit I can move to, even though I just got Internet set up. I can deal with loud music or crying babies, but the tweaker guy barking curses as he goes by my apartment every day is going to throw me over the edge.

Tomorrow though, a little better.

Best wishes, ~g

item.title: Everything Black
item.description: I could listen to this all day. (Everything Black by Unlike Pluto) Aaaaalright! I‚Äôve got to be more focused than yesterday. Or ‚Ä¶ well‚Ä¶
item.content:encoded:
I could listen to this all day. (Everything Black by Unlike Pluto)

Aaaaalright! I‚Äôve got to be more focused than yesterday. Or ‚Ä¶ well, focused on the right things, because I definitely got some practice in trying to solve something seemingly intractable ‚Ä¶ and failed, lol ‚Ä¶ but I can still develop the iOS app, and I‚Äôve got to make as much progress as I possibly can today so that I can have busted this out over the weekend and send it along to Dave, and be free to work on other things. So:

  • Get the list sort, list select, and QR code select working
  • Get the route param to Logoing
  • Set up the Logoing screen, that‚Äôs the camera, camera roll button, shutter, draggable logo, and the instructions tooltip that‚Äôs got to animate into the question mark icon
  • That icon, tapping it should animate back out that instructions box ‚Ä¶ and the first time it should be up for like a second and a half, and tapping anywhere should close it, then subsequent times it should be up ‚Ä¶ five seconds? Indefinitely? Tapping anywhere should close it though. Maybe after five seconds an okay button should pop up?
  • Anyway, get the camera and react-native-viewshot wired up, get the image, save it to the camera roll, or if that‚Äôs cancelled go back to logoing, and then navigate to sharing, which I think I need to split up into the caption copying phase and the share to Instagram phase, because that‚Äôs just a lot to expect of people that they‚Äôll digest everything in one screen. So screen one might be more instruction heavy, and have a button that copies the caption and gives you a nice animated check, good job, and then the next screen should have some more instruction and have an open Instagram button and an ‚ÄòI did it‚Äô button, which should be disabled until the open Instagram button is pressed, and then that should hypothetically ping the server to check and see if they actually did it, send them to loading, and if it returns good, send them on to the home screen with the drawer and a pointer for where to see the status of the raffle or their reward or whatever we‚Äôre going, and then if it doesn‚Äôt, give them the error message and send them back to the logoing screen ‚Ä¶ with the full stack history so if they don‚Äôt want to take another picture and know how to navigate with gestures, they can swipe forward. Maybe even add to the instruction box.
  • Getting the server up and ready will be a whole other thing. Should puh-robably wait until I hear back from the other devs/Dave. I can start on Run Club though, I just learned a ton about auth, navigation, etc etc. Okay go!

Okay, first thing was getting the actual app to launch, right? I brought a bunch of the files over from the last time I used React Native, and it‚Äôs trying to load dependencies and breaking ‚Ä¶

Oh jeez, I just checked Google Analytics and people are actually going to my website. Oh boy. Maybe revisit that before Run Club.

Oop, step one, I set the isLoading flag off to try and bust through not having Internet on the emulator ‚Ä¶ //

Okay, I got way further with the list sort going, typing in the TextInput filters the list! It‚Äôs beautiful! And the route param is definitely being passed along. I took Dawa for another walk and put myself together, and I‚Äôm going to go over things from the navigation level again with my second cup of coffee to get my head back into it here. // Ooor I‚Äôm going to talk with the student loans people for a bit. Yay.

Ooof, okay, just fixed up the auth flow and the forms, learned about putting things you need to happen based on awaited values up in the try part of a try-catch rather than after, and the Formik is great, but the little things I‚Äôm doing with inputs and how easy it is to use state and handlers makes it more of a hassle than it‚Äôs worth right now. And now we have app icons again yaaay :) Yea, that was totally broken though, if there was an access token in storage, it was just setting loading to false whether it worked or not, and then when I had auth set up recursively, I had the recursion set up wrong so it kept ‚Ä¶ on ‚Ä¶ running ‚Ä¶ tryAuth() ‚Ä¶

My back is killing me, first upgrade purchase, unless it‚Äôs a webcam, needs to be a new chair. Can‚Äôt find handleSubmit ‚Ä¶ hmm ‚Ä¶ ah, handleFormSubmit ‚Ä¶ ooo, and the hasTextBeenChanged state and the button being disabled worked, but it should automatically blow away the placeholder onFocus probably ‚Ä¶ ooo, nice, got KeyboardAvaoidingView working, and wrapping the Text in a View stopped it from jumping up. Oh, and sending back params rather than sending callback functions through, that makes sense ‚Ä¶ unless it causes ProfileCreation to rerender jankily. Ugh, it does. That‚Äôs got to be a later thing though, it‚Äôs noon, and I‚Äôve fixed some things, but broken very little new ground. //

Alrighty, got WiFi! Didn‚Äôt realize it was Monday, and not Sunday, until the WiFi guy called though, lol. Also my computer hasn‚Äôt magically gotten better, oh well. I did get a new cable that goes to the hard drive though! Apparently that‚Äôs what‚Äôs failing, not the hard drives, because I plugged a brand new hard drive in and it didn‚Äôt see that one either. I‚Äôm not sure what to do now, exactly ‚Ä¶ I have a todo list that‚Äôs just like the whole page next to me. Inhale. Exhale. Please can the debugger connect ‚Ä¶ frozen at 4791/4791 ‚Ä¶ reboot everything, lol.

Okay, awesome, list sort just needs case sensitivity and changing how submit works, select works, just maybe if they start to backspace that gets handled better ‚Ä¶ oo, maybe showing the last time it changed? I could go down a rabbit hole there, also styling isn‚Äôt great, logos aren‚Äôt included yada yada. Sends the prop along though! I wonder if the couch might hurt my back less, lol.

Sweet relief! Except that Dawa is now ‚Ä¶

Hmm ‚Ä¶ so the CodeScanner screen works ‚Ä¶ sort of. It takes apart the url properly, it seems, and navigates to ‚ÄúLogoing‚Äù, and passes along the business ‚Ä¶ the barcode reader seems to keep on going though, like the camera is still on ‚Ä¶ I wonder if conditionally rendering the whole screen would do it.

// Oh boy. React Native development is great when it‚Äôs great ‚Ä¶ not so much when it‚Äôs not. Oh, it finally loaded. Holy moley. Why is the network suddenly dead though? Ahhhhh!

Yes! Conditionally rendering the CodeScanner screen totally shut down the camera! Starting to lose the ability to focus, though. Good day! Not as much done as I would have liked, but some solid progress where I thought I might get stuck. To the future!

And best wishes! ~g

item.title: Why Will Semicolons Be Everywhere In The Coming Months?
item.description: A little pandemic humor to start today off. Oof. Okay, not really sure where to jump in today. There‚Äôs more auth stuff to tidy up, or I was‚Ä¶
item.content:encoded:
A little pandemic humor to start today off. Oof.

Okay, not really sure where to jump in today. There‚Äôs more auth stuff to tidy up, or I was thinking of seeing what libraries were out there to handle search in React Native, since I really have no idea where I‚Äôd start there ‚Ä¶ I mean, I guess you just have the list of things, and display a FlatList, and then onChangeText you filter for ones that include that string? Huh, actually, I could do that. Maybe. Let‚Äôs see. How about I go over the auth thing one more time, maybe there will be some low hanging fruit and I can get my fingers flying, and then we try the search thing, and then I was thinking, since it looks like the Instagram API is on total lock-down these days, it might be prudent to see if I could write a node service that hits instagram.com/{user-name} and whether pulling the profile pic in would be feasible. Which is spelled f-e-a-s-i-b-l-e ‚Ä¶ gotta see about a spell-checker in this thing. Oh well.

Aaand yelling tweaker outside my window. Great.

Aaand navigation options have stopped working entirely. Can‚Äôt header none, can‚Äôt change the header title even. What. // Now it works after deleting and reinstalling the app. Yay. Half an hour later ‚Ä¶ // Oop, it‚Äôs back. Why.

RNDebugger: Network tab, DISABLE CACHE!!! //

Alrighty, much later. Mental health somewhat rejuvenated, got Dawa for a brief run, then got one in myself, had some soup, made coffee, took Dawa out again, back to it here. Listened to the React Native Radio podcast with Ryan Christiani at Shopify, what was pretty dope. I downloaded that as soon as I saw it, since I‚Äôd just worked with some of their embedded code on the Lyme Art Association, which waaas ‚Ä¶ yea. A learning experience, for sure, and also definitely a confidence booster, seeing it live on the Internet, even through the rest of the site is still ‚Ä¶ it still needs work, but that‚Äôs something they can find a budget for or live with :)

Where were we? I just found out that you can pass callback functions through route params, but the yellow box yelled at me for it, so that‚Äôs a question mark, and then building out the business selection page.

Ahh, small things eat my time! That‚Äôs part of it, though, and part of why I‚Äôm so bad at estimating how long something will take :\ Like, why is this simple CenteringView component making everything nearly invisible?
