item.content:encoded:
IN WHICH GARETH DOES THE WORK, lol. That kinda morning. Not feeling it, but it‚Äôs time to (you guessed it) do the work.

Okay, deep breath. Tabs. Implement tabs. Make tabs pretty. Next step forms. Make form. Make auth. Make menu for auth route. Switch projects. Make auth for projects. Make server. Handle auth for projects with server. Make forms for projects. Step 11: profit.

Time estimation practice! Implementing tabs: three minutes, 8:54 - 8:57, go!

‚Ä¶ 9:24. So only ten times off, lol. What happened? Let‚Äôs see ‚Ä¶ the Nav component was off somewhere, so had to do that whole deal, and then I was rendering Buttons within Tabs when the Tabs were rendering buttons, also I had to use the restroom, also I got distracted and had to fix my tabs-test project, and then I forgot to destructure { onClick } from useTabsState(). Also, remember if you want to use a switch statement again in your JSX, the trick is to use an IIFE. Oof.

Hmm ‚Ä¶ just deleted work from this file ‚Ä¶ estimated that I‚Äôd be done with the next step by ten, from 9:36, so 24 minutes ‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs 9:51 ‚Ä¶ what did I do with those icons? AAYYY, in ../dep/before-gastby/src/assets! Lolll ‚Ä¶

Eugh, sudo yarn add yada-yada ‚Ä¶ no beuno! I have to nuke this machine soon. 10:12.

Oh, why is saving/formatting taking forever? Whoop, turn it off, back on again, works. Eep.

Ahh, I get so frustrated with CSS! With JS, you can just console log something and it‚Äôll tell you what‚Äôs happening, unless it lies to you because it was pushed to the end of the call stack or it‚Äôs a reference error or something, with CSS ‚Ä¶ well, I mean, it‚Äôs my own incompetence, I‚Äôve got to look in the mirror on this, not out the window.

The specific issue is ‚Äúhow to SVG?‚Äù I mean, I was able to load them through Gatsby by using the graphql query for their public url, as they‚Äôre in the assets folder at build time, and then they worked as the source of image tags, but how to access their svg properties, to like change the color? Solution 1 is to go into the svg files and add the stroke color manually, which I could do but would be sub-optimal, as I‚Äôd have to have multiple files with different colors and switch between them if I wanted to change them like on hover, then a slightly better Solution 2 could be to use string interpolation and inject the variable that way, but like, also unwieldly, and then Solutions 3 through 5 are to set them as the background image of a div and filter the background, or figure out the ‚Äòuse‚Äô tag, or some other way, because this is sort of all a bit of a mystery to me. Solution 6 is pick another library, let‚Äôs see what we can do though.

Huh, okay, so stack overflow had a solution using a namespaced href, xlink:href, for use tags, but React said no can do, but MDN had just an href attribute ‚Ä¶ so they‚Äôre ‚Ä¶ 0 x 34px ‚Ä¶ whoa ‚Ä¶ okay, so the solution, for the moment, is to use this CodePen by Barrett Sonntag to get a ‚Äòfilter‚Äô for the svg imported into an image in the desired color. Hacky af, but it is what it is! //

Ooohhkeeeday! I‚Äôm going a little crazy here between the coughing neighbors and the yelling tweaker neighbors and that it‚Äôs just so cold, and I can‚Äôt seem to warm up, but the article recommended to me yesterday on Reactiflux by Kent C. Dodds was a breath of fresh air, and even though I didn‚Äôt totally understand 100% of it right away, it gave me confidence that there‚Äôs a mesa of sanity, where if you can reach it, you can see what the heck is going on here with state management in React. I‚Äôm going to do my best to take the step back I need to take right now and get the styling right for these tabby-bits, and we‚Äôll do it up. (‚Ä¶what? Whatever, go!)

item.title: The Space Between
item.description: The space between ‚Ä¶ the tears we cry is the laughter keeps us coming back for more ‚Ä¶ the space between ‚Ä¶ ‚Äî Dave Matthews Band, ‚ÄúThe Space‚Ä¶
item.content:encoded:
The space between ‚Ä¶ the tears we cry is the laughter keeps us coming back for more ‚Ä¶ the space between ‚Ä¶ ‚Äî Dave Matthews Band, ‚ÄúThe Space Between‚Äù

The Problem

So I‚Äôve got an idea for a layout for my landing page, seems pretty simple, there‚Äôs already a header, then a ‚Äòbio‚Äô component, and a footer, and I want to have a nav bar that works like tabs and a space for the main content fill up the remaining space, with the whole thing taking up 100% of the vertical space of the screen, so like only that main content part being able to scroll, at least on desktop and tablet.

So what‚Äôs the big deal? Height of the screen is easy, 100vh, then just subtract the height of the header, bio component, footer, account for any padding, bada-bing, bada-boom.

Not so fast, cowboy! Maybe there is a simple solution and my CSS skills just aren‚Äôt what they need to be, but googling it pulls up a lot of results for when the heights of the other elements are known or can be easily calculated, and if I‚Äôd rolled all of this myself, I‚Äôd be able to add it up simply, even accounting for changing heights based on font sizes with the rem unit, but I used gatsby-starter-blog, which has been great, but like the first h1 tag has font: 106.25%/1.45 and line-height: 1.15 and ‚Ä¶ wait ‚Ä¶

The Solution

Well, the solution ends up being, I think, that I‚Äôm an idiot and didn‚Äôt see that literally every bit of height, margin, and padding in this whole arrangement is based on the rem unit, and like three minutes of trial and error is going to get me were I need to be. I was about to do this whole thing with react-sizeme, which is a library that gives you something like element queries, which isn‚Äôt a thing yet, but because the index page renders the layout component that takes in children as a prop, and only part of that needed to be sized, based on its siblings, but also based on the other components in ‚Äòlayout‚Äô, it was going to be this whole thing.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre the dumbest smart person I know.‚Äù ‚Äî Dave Crump

Yyyeap, 14.2 was the magic number. Why not 17.825 or 20.65343? Great question. There‚Äôs 3.625rem missing in my calculations somewhere, but now we have new challenges! Yay! Oh, actually, there‚Äôs a whole other 3.625rem missing, too. What in the what. Oh wait, no, subtraction, I found the initial 3.625rem, lol.

Moving On

Hmm, so there are solutions for having the scrollbar always be visible with the ::-webkit-scrollbar:vertical pseudoelement and pseudoclass ‚Ä¶ Steven Lewis‚Äô CodePen on it ‚Ä¶ which we‚Äôre going to leave for now, and revisit when I have more content.

Okay, wow, coming along! Wonder how it looks on mobile, lol. Oh, jeez. So the header wraps a line and blows away the math I did, and the -px to the left that I used to create the two key lines sends it right off the screen, but one thing at a time here.

Oooh, todo: credit Chris Coyier‚Äôs article for the button reset. Oh, I‚Äôm doing tabs stupidly, though. I feel like I‚Äôm more in CSS mode, so let me get the styling a little better, then I‚Äôll take Dawa for another walk and come back to JS-land.

Oof, needs a bit more work, wow though. Can‚Äôt sit anymore though :) //

Boyo, we got a long one in! I mean, we‚Äôve had longer ones, even recently, but considering being sick, that was ‚Ä¶ how far was that? I use mapmyrun.com for this type of thing ‚Ä¶

Okay, made some slight changes, going to just fix up the buttons and I‚Äôm going to look for jobs to apply to! It‚Äôs go time!

Oh no ‚Ä¶ the itis! I knew I shouldn‚Äôt have had that last spoonful of beans, but it was sooo gooood! Alright, I need to return to this with a fresh mind. ///..

item.content:encoded:
I need to put my heart into it today, that‚Äôs how we‚Äôre going to make it through.

Okay, so the design thing ‚Ä¶ I think if I can get the major blocks of content squared away, and then handle positioning the content within them to get what I want, that‚Äôs how we‚Äôre going to do this.

Indentation? Indentation.

Okay brain, vroom vroom. I started with coffee after walking Dawa and putting myself together today because it‚Äôs raining and I‚Äôm feeling not-so-great and wasn‚Äôt going to try and handle a coffee cup, umbrella, and dog, but it‚Äôs definitely taking a bit to get going.

So we‚Äôve got padding on the body ‚Ä¶ oh, I put that there. Then the top level div in Layout ‚Ä¶ which is about to get capitalized, I have to make this project feel like mine, you know? And I capitalize component file names. And all exported from an index ‚Ä¶ oh no, apparently no indentation, prettier deletes it on save. \t?

\tIndentation? LOL nope.

¬†¬†Indentation? Well, cool, &nbsp&nbsp works, destroys my own readability though. First world problems.

Anyway, we‚Äôve got the padding left over from the last project that I copy-pasted in, some of which needs to stay because I‚Äôve got the 16px ::before, whiiich I just realized I needed to fix for mobile, where it‚Äôs 12px on top. Alright, blew that away, now we‚Äôve got got the 2.175rem padding on top and bottom and 1.0875rem padding to the left and right, header is a header with an h1 with marginBottom, then a main with no styling, then a footer with no styling. Eugh, so the styling for the Bio component is kind of annoying, what do we have here ‚Ä¶ the wrapper is display flex with a marginBottom of 3.625rem, and then the image wrapper is 50x50 with a marginRight of 0.725rem ‚Ä¶ then typography.js is applying a marginBottom of 1.16rem to img tags, interesting what they‚Äôre doing with the picture element there ‚Ä¶ okay and then the p tag gets marginBottom 1.16rem from typography ‚Ä¶ then it‚Äôs block level and block level for nav and main-content, where I‚Äôm going to want a flex wrapper. I‚Äôd love if I could get that image a little bigger, center align the text to it, push the title and bio back a little to create those key lines ‚Ä¶ let‚Äôs see what we can do with the picture first, because if it‚Äôs too complicated to change that, then we‚Äôve got how many pixels to push, lol.

Okay, gatsby-transformer-sharp is what we learn now ‚Ä¶ whoa. Okay. Crazy. GraphQL coming back, that‚Äôs how you name something, those are arguments, that‚Äôs a fragment ‚Ä¶ which isn‚Äôt available in GraphiQL ‚Ä¶ yaaay, I did it! Got avatar for blog posts, and bigAvatar for the main page, lol! 96px, then we‚Äôll want, let‚Äôs see ‚Ä¶ can I push things to the left with negative padding and not mess up the margin auto? Not going to lie, layout is not my strong suit.

Bwaa, no, and also I liked having more space at the top ‚Ä¶ aww, sweet, dude! Good ‚Äòole position relative and left -px! Okay, now the next steps are to get the nav and main-content areas squared away, and then I‚Äôm going to rewatch that video from Kevin Powell on designing with pseudoelements ‚Ä¶ jk dog-walking time //

I love how going for a walk is so often the solution when you can‚Äôt solve a problem. I was like, how can I possibly get the nav and main-content area to fill up the remaining space, and on my walk I was like, well durr, you know the heights of the other elements, use calc(100vh - all-that-jazz) and bada-bing, bada-boom. So let‚Äôs see ‚Ä¶ oh, jeez, need to add 16px of left to the main div, too ‚Ä¶ well, 7.25rem to account for the vertical padding on the main layout div ‚Ä¶ oh no, I have no idea why the header is that height. This is why element queries would be dope. Oh, there‚Äôs a library called react-sizeme, this is going to be a pain in the butt ‚Ä¶ that‚Äôs okay, let‚Äôs do it. Eugh, so ‚Ä¶ I need the header component to be aware of its size and pass that back up to the state in the index page, as well as the footer, as well as Bio ‚Ä¶ all of this is massively overkill, and I should have just rolled my own typography ‚Ä¶ should‚Äôa, would‚Äôa, could‚Äôa, let‚Äôs get this done. Is this the case for useEffect? //

Ahhh! I‚Äôm trying to work, but from being outside for a while and not being able to warm up, and the people yelling outside, and the people yelling upstairs, and the chicken on the stove for Dawa popping and crackling, and the stupidly loud cars in the parking lot, I can‚Äôt concentrate! I‚Äôm tired, and headphones aren‚Äôt going to help. Oh, fuck that dude whose only mode up or down the stairs is ‚Äòrun as clompily as possible.‚Äô I need to follow Meg Lewis‚Äô advice and listen to my brain, and I‚Äôll be more productive later.

Signing out, and best wishes, ~g

item.title: Back Up!
item.description: Good morning! Still not feeling like 100%, but I have routines to lean on. Get up (before the alarm today! Must have slept!) and make coffee‚Ä¶
item.content:encoded:
Good morning! Still not feeling like 100%, but I have routines to lean on. Get up (before the alarm today! Must have slept!) and make coffee, tidy up, walk Dawa, put myself together, work out, eat breakfast, take Dawa for a second walk, make a second cup of coffee, and it‚Äôs coding time!

First thing, changed the title from Gareth Field, Dot Com! to Gareth Field ‚Ä¶ Dot Com! because that sounds more authentically enthusiastic in my head, and changed the base maxWidth of the wrapper div so that it all fit on one line, next up is to fix that one thing about the typography plugin that includes its own color for link underlines, and to remove the anchor tag over the title, and then it‚Äôs time to lay out the main content, and basically I want it to be like a tabs situation on desktop/tablet, and an accordian situation on mobile, and I‚Äôm not going to worry about the menu I was going to put at the top left, all those links can go in the footer, and then I‚Äôm going to send out some resumes! I have no idea if I‚Äôm good enough, I‚Äôve been doing this for six years now, but I‚Äôve been working and handling life at the same time, but I need to get myself out there (digitally, lol, still under quarantine) and see what happens! So the plan is to get this site to a ‚Äògood enough‚Äô state, apply for some jobs, reach out to my social network, handle some administrative stuff, and work on Run Club afterwards, as a reward. Spencer Carli put out a whole series on react-navigation version 5, so that‚Äôll probably be my starting point to dive back into it.

Let‚Äôs go!

‚Ä¶ Let‚Äôs also test block quotes!

Give me your tired, your poor, your huddled masses yearning to breathe free, the wretched refuse of your teeming shore.

Send these, the homeless, tempest-tossed to me, I lift my lamp beside the golden door!

‚Äî Emma Lazarus, 1883

Hmm, interesting, so smartypants works, though it turns the @ symbol into something obnoxious, and it ignored new lines. Does the pre tag work here?

Words
on
multiple
lines ...

Mmm, yea, but how to combine? That‚Äôs not a now problem, that‚Äôs a later problem.

Give me your tired, your
poor, your huddled masses
yearning to breathe free, the
wretched refuse of your
teeming shore.
 
Send these, the homeless,
tempest-tossed to me, I lift
my lamp beside the golden door!
 
-- Emma Lazarus, 1883

Oh, now we have a font problem ‚Ä¶ and smartypants didn‚Äôt get the em-dash, either. Le sigh.

Layout time. Main objectives: alter ‚Äòbio‚Äô for landing page, set up the nav bar and main areas, make it work on mobile, make the footer content, and populate the main content.

Sweet, okay, bio adjusted, removed the title link on the landing page ‚Ä¶ where to put this blog content? Oh, I‚Äôm going to have to store the current tab somewhere, because hitting back after going to a blog post should return you to the homepage with the coding tab selected and probably scrolled to the right place ‚Ä¶ Ehhh, we‚Äôll get there, let‚Äôs start by just omitting it and getting the area for the nav bar and main content set up on desktop, like, part one stuff here.

Alright, so main is just children of layout right now ‚Ä¶ need a nav component ‚Ä¶

Lol I‚Äôm glad like every keystroke and error message aren‚Äôt recorded ‚Ä¶ as I totally forget how to author and use components for a split sec ‚Ä¶ //

Okay, dog walked again, ready to tackle this nav thing. Just going to write the desktop version for the moment. Nav takes up a space, main takes up a space, main renders content based on what nav item is selected. How hard could it hOw HaRd CoUlD iT bE?

Lol, it‚Äôd be much easier without the local tweaker wandering back and forth in front of my apartment barking swearwords. But for the grace of God goes I, I suppose though.

Successfully extracted the BlogList into it‚Äôs own component! I know I kinda asked for it by choosing gatsby-starter-blog, but I‚Äôm at the point where I can look at how data is flowing through this thing and make changes. Alright, why is my dummy nav component rendering first here, though? Mmm, okay, after header, before children, but on the landing page, bio is part of children. So nav should be part of index? Yyy ‚Ä¶ yes. Maybe? This is where I need to use pen and paper for a sanity check ‚Ä¶ no, I can think through this, I only need the nav component on the index page, the layout is included as part of the index page, and also the blog posts, but the blog posts are created as pages because of gatsby-node and the template file, so anything special I‚Äôd want to change about the blog posts, except for the bio which is aware of location, I‚Äôd change in the template file and possibly ‚Ä¶ pass in ‚Ä¶ no, it gets its own pageQuery, because its (they‚Äôre) a page (pages,) and then anything special I‚Äôd want to change about the index page I change in /pages/index, which is the only place I want Nav, right? For the moment? And then how about main, because in layout, main contains children ‚Ä¶ of ‚Ä¶ of page, except layout ‚Ä¶ nav is child of layout in main ‚Ä¶ other children on layout in main are affected by nav ‚Ä¶ omg shoot me, yea, pen and paper diagramming time.

Sweeeeet, figured out images in blog posts, too!

Okay, so, section, article, or div? I remember listening to a JavaScript Jabber episode with the semantic HTML guy and he said to like never use one of those two, article or section ‚Ä¶ section? Okay, are the elements semantically related, no, use div, got it.

Oh man, need state, reaching for hooks! I‚Äôm so modern, lol.

LOL oh no, I have no idea what I‚Äôm doing. Efffff.

Oh, J/K, I just needed to refresh the page. Silly me. Yay I get hooks! Sort of! We‚Äôre passing functions, we‚Äôre doing all that stuff, yeah! My legs are falling asleep! //

Definitely still sick, acutally took a nap there. I like never take a nap, and I know like people are dying, so big whoop, but like I‚Äôm about as healthy as someone could expect to be ‚Ä¶ anyway, I‚Äôve got a moment here, must press on. Definitely not applying for jobs today ‚Ä¶ I always think I can get so much more done in a day! Wtf, me?!

Okay, so right now we‚Äôve got just a div with maxWidth set, marginLeft and marginRight auto, and padding. So let‚Äôs see, we want height to be 100vh and overflow hidden, and then the mainContent div will be scrollable, and somehow we‚Äôve got to establish first and second key lines for horizontal rhythm, with the title, avatar, and tab icons aligned to the first key line, and the blurb and tab titles aligned to the second, with content following. And my dog wants to be fed. So at least we got that far, lol.

Oof, so, got some conditional rendering going with an IIFE, because I like that inline style, dog is fed, dog wants another walk, check out Healthcare Triage for the latest on coronavirus Covid-19, stay safe out there, I‚Äôm going to call it, pretty productive day, maybe could have done a little better, what a time though.

Best wishes, ~g

item.title: And Down For A Bit ...
item.description: Oof, what a day. Just jumped through every hoop to try and get tested, and at least got a doctor‚Äôs note to quarantine for two weeks. So like‚Ä¶
item.content:encoded:
Oof, what a day. Just jumped through every hoop to try and get tested, and at least got a doctor‚Äôs note to quarantine for two weeks.

So like, eugh, I‚Äôm sick, hopefully things aren‚Äôt going to get worse, but also like, ayy, it‚Äôs ‚Äúget a new job‚Äù time.

And given how my current boss has handled this, it‚Äôs definitely ‚Äúget a new job‚Äù time. Goodness ‚Ä¶

So, as the coffee kicks in, I‚Äôve got to get my bearings here. Oh yea, let‚Äôs see if the Google Analytics thing got any hits! ‚Ä¶ and we wait, lol ‚Ä¶ I thought I‚Äôd be slick with it and just use my phone‚Äôs unlimited data plan and good connection around here for my Internet, but it turns out there‚Äôs a cap on high-speed data as a hotspot ‚Ä¶ Hmm, didn‚Äôt seem to record anything. Maybe I‚Äôll have my sister Elsbeth go to it a few times, if she has time. They‚Äôre self-isolating, too. Crazy right now.

Okay, vroom-vroom, let‚Äôs do this thing.

Okay, so there‚Äôs more under-the-hood things going on with images and stuff, I‚Äôd really like to get the main appearance of this thing a little closer to what I had with the create-react-app version, and ideally somewhat further along with that, because more than I need this to do all of the really interesting stuff I‚Äôm looking forward to doing with it, I need it to look presentable so I can start sending resumes out, like today.

The typography package, though, let me just look into how rhythm works ‚Ä¶ oh, okay, that‚Äôs a function of line height, I saw like rhythm(3 / 4) and thought we were doing something super fancy. I mean it‚Äôs fancy, but ‚Ä¶ got it, okay, keep moving. Definitely lost a minute looking at different typography themes and am definitely going to go with a different one than the project comes with ‚Ä¶ to the future though.

Okay, orientation ‚Ä¶ /pages, top level is /pages ‚Ä¶ index ‚Ä¶ and here we‚Äôve got a component that‚Äôs the default export called BlogIndex, and because we‚Äôre also exporting a const pageQuery which is a Gatsby graphql query, we get a ({ data }) prop, and I‚Äôm not exactly sure where ({ location }) is coming from, but we‚Äôve got that too ‚Ä¶ let me log that ‚Ä¶ hmm, wonder what ‚Äòstate‚Äô is there? Got it though, pathname, hostname, url, all that jazz. Oh, also I wonder what prism.css is, just checked out the imports in gatsby-browser ‚Ä¶ oh a syntax highlighter! Oh, I‚Äôll have to use this!

Alright, then we‚Äôve got the Layout component, taking in location and siteTitle, pulled from data.site.siteMetadata, then an SEO component, then a ‚ÄòBio‚Äô component, then a map of posts to article tags with all sorts of good stuff in there. I don‚Äôt see any media queries on Bio, how resonsive is this? Hmm, okay, works with simple content ‚Ä¶ and okay, so the blog-post template also uses Layout ‚Ä¶ and so basically I want to retain that layout for blog content and pages like ‚Äòcredits‚Äô for the icons I‚Äôm going to steal use from the wonderful folk involved in the Noun Project, but I want something custom for the landing page ‚Ä¶

Okay, interesting, so Layout gets location, title (siteTitle), and children, and switches what the header is based on whether the path is / or not. Oh, okay, so we‚Äôve got h1s and h3s going on, and the h1 on the landing page is scaled up by 1.5.

Oh, that‚Äôs how to use styled components, with gatsby-plugin-styled-components and then import styled from 'styled-components' ‚Ä¶ how do I use Prism for better syntax highlighting? So much exciting stuff to learn here!! First styled-components, and reorganizing the utils folder, pulling in my own stuff, injecting a global styles to get my fancy body{ &::before { going ‚Ä¶

Oh YAAAYYY!!! I know it‚Äôs a split for everyone, how they write styles, but I‚Äôve been using styled-components for years, it‚Äôs how I do :) //

Okeeday, dog walked again, dishes done and ready to cook dinner, but let me keep going on this. SO happy that I could just bring over the global styles from the other project, colors and breakpoints up and running, I feel like we‚Äôre rocking and rolling here. Oh the before pseudo-element doesn‚Äôt work the same now the window can be scrolled ‚Ä¶ hmm ‚Ä¶ ohh, fixed it immediately, let‚Äôs hear it for position: fixed ‚Ä¶ but let‚Äôs then hear it for some different typography, because the line height for paragraphs is way to small, and the font for headers is goofy.

Ohhkay, well I changed the theme and the fonts, and I like that links are underlined, because that‚Äôs accessible, but the main header h1 needs to not be a link, and the colors need to be on brand, and also I haven‚Äôt changed up like the main layout of the page yet, but we‚Äôre getting there!

BTW the GitHub mobile app just dropped! Whaaat!! I think I‚Äôm done for the night, though, unless I get a magical burst of energy later, still sick and feeling it, lol.

Best wishes! ~g

P.S. Okay, I lied a little, opened everything up after walking Dawa again and feeding him, and the underline color for links is achieved with backgroundImage! Weird! I kinda want to just fork the theme and customize it that way, but that‚Äôs definitely a morning task.

item.title: Up And Running!
item.description: Alright, let‚Äôs do this thing! I‚Äôm switching the whole site over to Gatsby rather than just a part of it, using gatsby-starter-blog, and so I‚Ä¶
item.content:encoded:
Alright, let‚Äôs do this thing!

I‚Äôm switching the whole site over to Gatsby rather than just a part of it, using gatsby-starter-blog, and so I‚Äôm going to go through this plugin by plugin and see what‚Äôs up here.

Starting with gatsby-plugin-google-analytics! Sweet! Learned I was still a part of the Fastblr analytics account, lol! That was a blog I got paid to write for a few years ago, didn‚Äôt really go anywhere, but hey, I can say I‚Äôve been paid to write! Okay, account created for this site, tracking ID plugged in, and I followed the instructions on Neil Patel‚Äôs site to protect the traffic data from being corrupted. Thanks Neil!

Let‚Äôs see if I can launch the thing and record a hit ‚Ä¶ //

Lol, well, launch, check, today we learned Google Analytics is not realtime though.

Just tightened the bolts in this desk, omg, so much better. It was rattling as I typed, that was driving me crazy. Okay, page launched, dog walked, desk tightened, does /bounce still work? What‚Äôs that called? Asking Reactiflux ‚Ä¶ ‚Äúserver routing‚Äù or ‚Äúserving static files,‚Äù so maybe I can say that ‚Ä¶ well I mean, Gatsby is still rendering routes statically, but I‚Äôm using server routing to render the /bounce route with just a set of html, css, and javascript files.

Yay it still works! This is the silliest thing, but I made a page that spawns a random-ish number of red balls that bounce around on a blue background in random-ish directions at random-ish speeds, and it‚Äôs definitely not the most advanced thing in the world, lol, but I made it so long ago, and was so proud of myself for working through the problems and getting it to work that going to garethfield.com/bounce has always been a comfort, though it‚Äôs like one pixel off to the right and bottom so it scrolls just a little, frantically, lol, but that‚Äôs a thing to fix at a later time.

Alright, next up, gatsby-plugin-react-helmet, and here I‚Äôm going to have to dig into a few things, because I get what Helmet generally does, it adds meta info and all that jazz, but looking at the SEO component, I‚Äôm going to have to look up the useStaticQuery function at least. I think I remember this being part of the new hotness that Gatsby is allowing for around having some of your content be dynamically generated, let‚Äôs see if I‚Äôm right. Sweet, right on, used to have PageQuery that took in context and could only be called at the page level and StaticQuery that took in no context but could be called on any component, and now we‚Äôve got the useStaticQuery hook.

I thought hooks were going to be crazy hard to learn, I think taking a step back into plain javascript land for a bit did me a load of good. Yay for Wes Bos‚Äô Beginner JavaScript course!

Okay, so instead of using the Helmet component directly, there‚Äôs an SEO component that takes in a title (required,) and optionally a description, lang, and array of metas, and adds a bunch by default from the site data ‚Ä¶ where does that live again? It‚Äôs been a while since I‚Äôve really worked on a Gatsby site, like the Bruckner Oncology project :( gatsby-config, right. I wonder if I should ‚Ä¶ yes, lol, the answer is yes, I should make a Twitter account again. I will take a deep breath before tweeting this time around, I promise, lol.

Ooo, that‚Äôs one sleek form, Twitter. Also, I am really used to verification by sms at this point. That was one of the coolest things we got working at the AWS meetup around Amplify and MobileHub and all that jazz.

Alright beezleys, it‚Äôs @barefootgareth to y‚Äôall!

Oh, so easily distracted ‚Ä¶ took off on a js package managers journey because Microsoft just bought NPM (‚Ä¶eep,) and then a little journey on Chakra UI, which looks dope and has a Gatsby plugin! Where were we though, metadata, metadata ‚Ä¶ Okay, definitely at a concentration limit, time for a groceries run and another walk for Dawa! // (btw, for whatever reason in my notes, I tend to leave a ‚Äô//‚Äô where I leave off for a while, and a ‚Äô///‚Äô for like a major break, like next day or later usually. Looking forward to getting my paper notes scanned!)

Whooooops, broke production! First of many, most likely, let‚Äôs dig in!

Eugh, so weird, I rebuilt it and pushed index.html over, and it works, but none of the newer blog content is there and the profile image is super wonky. I also am losing steam a little, and maybe should switch tasks so I stay interested, because honestly ‚Ä¶ I really love this stuff because it‚Äôs so cool writing code and talking with the machine and making something awesome for people, and I really need to work hard at it because there‚Äôs a lot of surface area, and frankly I‚Äôm not that smart, and it‚Äôs my best shot at not cleaning toilets the rest of my life ‚Ä¶ ahhh, I think the back pain is taking over the conversation at this point :(

Okay, let me just see if replacing everything gatsby-related has the site still working, so I know I‚Äôm not going crazy at least and can start from relatively fresh, though! I must say, I changed my GitHub password because I had a login from France on a different service and probably don‚Äôt have the best password security, and then my git stuff broke earlier, and I was reminded very quickly how much I don‚Äôt really know about git and ssh and credentials.

Or how much I have to learn! Got to stay positive! Got to call it, after this, too, I‚Äôm going to get Dawa‚Äôs dinner going, fetch the laundry, and try and get a good night‚Äôs sleep, and hopefully I don‚Äôt have the plague, here (search for the news on this date, lol. I called out tomorrow because I have a bit of a throat/upper respiratory/lower GI thing going on and don‚Äôt want to risk it-slash-need a mental health day after yesterday‚Äôs shift, holy moley ‚Ä¶) So!

Best wishes! ~g
